They make Shatangi a mean black & tan and have excellent pub grub (ask for curry sauce on the side to dip your fries in). Filled with bimbos screaming "wooo" weekend nights, but someone's always drunk enough to dance to the Beatles. Don't forget to sit in the confessional.

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
Pretty cool outdoor area and laid back vibe.  I came with a friend and we each had a drink, sat around for a bit, used the restroom and then left.  Not bad, not great....seems very reliable and predictable.


UPDATE********
Been back many times now.  They have awesome french fries.  Order a side of curry sauce with the fries.  Seriously tasty.
author: Tamar N.

description:
I've thought long and hard about whether I should write a review of this place. I came here on New Year's Eve with some friends, since a few of us (well, me, mostly) wanted a more low-key evening than one would find in a club full of beautiful people. And for the first hour, we had exactly the kind of fun, relaxed celebration we wanted. Somewhere along the way though, the bar became super crowded, and after too many drinks I became That Girl.... To everyone there that night, well, I'm sorry. And that's all I'll say about that!

Still, everything that happened before the midnight champagne toast was pretty cool. Awesome, laid-back crowd, especially in the back room, where we all sang along to "Bohemian Rhapsody" just before midnight. Nice, tucked away location off the street. Friendly, if harried bartenders; service was understandably slow but the nice Irish boy I met that night had no problems getting us served quickly. All in all, the Irish Bank holds a special place in my heart. I'd love to go back one of these days.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Drinking by the dumpster was never as much fun!

This place is relaxed, that's for sure!  Except if you are running out of chairs, in which case the evening turns into a desperate musical chairs competition (for some odd reason you are not allowed to drink standing up).

I don't know if it was because I had too many beers, but the chicken fingers were AMAZING!
author: Mrs. G.

description:
Holy crap the food here is AMAZING!

A few friends came in for the GLAAD Media Awards and we all ended up at Irish Bank after the front person at the hotel recommended it. We asked for a place with good Fish N Chips and this is the place they suggested.

It was some kind of night..  trivia, perhaps? So the place was low on space. Five of us managed to cram into this super tiny booth room made to seat two comfortably. We ended up having a blast being crammed in there and everyone loved their food. We ordered fries with various cheeses on them (mine had blue cheese and was orgasmic, others had cheddar), Fish N Chips, and Sheppard's Pie. 

It's possible that there was drinking going on that night but all I remember is the food. Highly recommended ++.
author: Chrissy Q.

description:
I love the Irish Bank! It is my go-to happy hour spot with coworkers and friends who work in the FiDi. I love the outdoor seating in the courtyard and especially love that they have heaters for outside!!! 

I recommend the drop top beer they have on tap here. it's delicious. always a promo going on with scantily clad marketing ladies giving you $1 off coupons for a new beer. 

great authentic irish pub feel, traditional pub food for lunch. i hear they have a good brunch, i'll have to check it out soon.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Scene:  Washington, DC.  Spring 2007

*phone rings*

Me:  Hello?
Her:  What are you doing?
Me:  Sitting on my ass.  What's up?
Her:  Get your ass up and come drink with me at *insert Irish bar name here*
Me:  OK.

6 hours later, we are usually getting into trouble with the other regulars.  Mostly her.  I am pure and innocent.  REALLY.

Cut to summer...we both move to the West coast; she moved to Seattle, I moved here.  I was missing my shenanigans at the bar.  A friend told me about the Bank.  I was in love.  It had the same vibe as our old local.  So here is the scene when I go:

*texting*

Me:  What are you doing?
Her:  *the answer varies*
Me:  I'm at the Irish Bank having a Guinness.
Her:  Whore.

I miss her.

This place makes me remember the good times with her and it is an awesome place.  The Irish stew and the Shepherds pie are tits.
author: Dottie G.

description:
Me and some campaign people (presidential campaign, i cant say who) came here after dinner with a political figure (also cant say who) for some drinks a few months ago (it took me that long to get yelp).  I remember the this figure needed to use the restroom after already starting the night of drinking at the restaurant.  The first words out of his mouth when he turned the corner to the restroom was:

"Holy crap!  There's Bobby Kennedy on the wall!"

Once I got over the fact that everything that night was on this guy's tab; I truly enjoy places where i can find Boddingtons on tap.  It makes me happy.
author: Reuben D.

description:
Probably the safest Bank around during these difficult times.
Love the faucet in the bathroom...
author: Dario B.

description: Wouldn't necessarily call Irish Bank a hidden gem since its well known around SF but for an out of towner like me, its pretty cool discovering a bar in an alley, which I consider pretty hidden.  Just right outside of a Chinatown gate, Irish Bank is a friendly neighborhood pub.  Tons of funny pictures and posters adore the walls, straight up old-school decor, its simple and sweet.  And as a golfer, the shoutouts and pictures of Padraig Harrington were awesome.  Bartenders are talkative and some are Irish themselves and its amazing how much more fun it is when you are in an Irish bar served by an Irish bartender.  Crowd is chill and yeah, just the easy going vibe and simplcity of getting beers and watching the game was fun.  Going to make sure to drop by this bar again.
author: Kevin F.

description:
This is more of an exchange than a bank.  The way it works is this:  you give them your money and they give you a great pint of beer.

Also, their famous reuben sandwich is mouth wateringly good.
author: Tim G.

description:
So, what can i say that has not already been said?  What can not be sung to the tune of how fabulous of a place this is... besides me chiming in and making a statement of admiration and affection for this establishment... nay an alter to pay homage to the time honored tradition of the 2 hours cocktail lunch.  Ok, it is not only good for cocktails, but their Fish and Chips are crispy and not too greasy as is most places. However, I would like for them to have a few more dishes like plowman's' lunch and Branson's pickles, but drunken beggars can not be choosers, yes?

In any event, try the food and stay for the booze.  Oh yes, do not forget to chat up the staff as they are not only friendly, clever and hot, but also love having a laugh at your expense
author: Jai D.

description: A great place to go to for a quick beer and sandwiches. The sitting area outside is perfect to hangout after a hectic day at work and smoke a cigarette along with your beer.
author: parviz d.

description:
Good happy hour bar which attracts a young and boisterous crowd.  The location is pretty central to FiDi and there are outdoor tables to sit and enjoy the weather, in addition to a few tables inside.

Can get crowded after work and on St Paddy's day and service can be a bit slow.  Their fries are yummy and they have a good selection of beers on tap.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Ima review this now just before i go back. I was taken here by some Irish (as in from Ireland, in town for a week from Dublin) friends like 8 months ago because they claimed it was "the only place in the city to get a proper pint of Guinness". I can't vouch for the proper pint, being Amer'kin and all, and i didn't actually remember the name or location of the place after, but a really fantastic time was had by all. My bf went there a month or two ago and when he started to describe the patio and ambiance, i immediately knew exactly what he was talking about, and have been wanting to go back ever since. Guess it left a good impression that first time. We're going back tonight.

UPDATE: Failed to go back. Will try again soon.
author: Jordan B.

description:
I had my 25th birthday *extravanganza* here. It's weird having to be thrown INTO a bar instead of being thrown OUT of a bar. Cute location. I love the outdoor seating, but HATE HATE HATE (-.5 star) the service that comes with the outdoor seating. It's slow and the waitress we ended up with was snooty and impatient (to drunk people) I MEAN COME ON! YOU WORK FOR A BAR!

The bartender (who makes AWFUL COSMOS -.5 star) was a nice guy but his friend who was hanging out there stole my boy's shot when we were toasting to me. He was peeved (the boy). The aforementioned bartender's friend (-1 star) also ho-ed out with my friend and now there's drama attached to that (i blame the Irish Bank for that). *shakes fists* 

The BLT was FANTASTIC! The stew was good too. The mac and cheese ended up on my sidewalk ... after a few (lots) of drinks ... DON'T YOU JUDGE ME!

the moral of the story (there isn't one): Don't eat mac and cheese when you KNOW you're going to ingest ungodly amounts of alcohol
author: Meryl Q.

description:
Been there a few times, but never when its packed. Good beers, GREAT food from what I've seen. Shepherd's Pie usually comes quickly - its always piping hot and filled with savory, meaty, potatoey goodness that I shovel in my mouth as quickly as I can. 

My friend has had the Irish breakfast and it seems like a lot of good food, perfect for a cold afternoon. The only thing I don't recommend is the Ploughman's platter or something like that - its some random salad, slices of cheese, and bread. 

People working there seem friendly, service speed is normal. Food comes pretty quickly in general, which makes this a great spot for a quick lunch and beer.
author: J C.

description:
In a hidden alley. We would have totally missed it if we weren't desperately looking for a place to eat.  It's sorta a paradise in its own world. 

Typical pub food, we didn't get much service. The waiter recommended beef stew, but seriously if that is the best dish, I would think twice about eating here again.

The restroom is glamorous, and one more star for the heater!
author: Tingting H.

description:
I can't swear to why anyone would rate this higher or lower than precisely four stars.

It sure beats the heck out of the cube rat / office mole existence, what with ample selection of cold brews and very fine fish & chips to be had... bump this place far to the five star side.

On the other hand it's not the greatest for people watching and all that jazz, so knock off a star and there we are, your basic, great food great pub not super-people-meeter place, the Irish Bank and Bar.

See you there.
author: Jim W.

description: I have nothing else to add except, The Bank pours the best pint of Guinness ive ever had.  Hands down.  And i love when Mary is working, she's so sweet and funny.   I use to only hit up The Bank on St. Paddy's Day (which really is a great celebration so i suggest if you havent been, you should go), but lately ive been getting dragged here a lot.  Comfortable as hell to drink in, great service, and yeah, great Guinness.  I especially like that this place is tucked away in a dark alley.  If you ever run out of space in your freezer to stash bodies, there are plenty o' dumpsters lined up.  *wink*
author: Juv C.

description: I've only been here one time before but it was for their St Patty's party after the parade. And it was awesome! Great, fun crowd, block party atmosphere, DJ and dancing outside, and the party went on for HOURS. I will most definitely be coming back!
author: Colleen M.

description: Best chicken strips I've found in SF.  Best with honey mustard to die for, and fries not so bad either.  But really, these chicken strips rock!
author: Sarah E.

description: Solid Irish food that's not too expensive.  The problem is inherent: that it's TOO unhealthy -- except the greens salad, which was good.  Good beer selection. Like the outdoor porch.
author: Andrew K.

description: This place is located in a little tiny alley so if you don't know where you're going, you might miss it.  When we were walking here, we were convinced we'd never find it.  But alas, we did!  This is a great little place in an off the beaten path location.  It definitely does remind me of the traditional pubs I'd see in Europe.  There's a lot of lighting and plenty of places to sit so if you actually want to see what people look like, then this is the place to go.  The vibe seems pretty relaxed as well.
author: Amy J.

description:
the fiance and i were invited by friends to check this place out yesterday - st. patrick's day - and were totally unprepared for the craziness. $5 cover to enter a giant block party, complete with bumpin' dance mixes, $6 beers, $10 irish car bombs *yum!* 
while i had a pretty good time - great crowd, easy to talk/yell to - the fiance left early b/c of the lack of cleanliness, inability to hear anything other than dance music, and lack of food. 
oh yah - if you're comin' from the east bay definitely BART it here. =)
author: Jasmine W.

description: The best part of the Irish Bank is its location and atmosphere. I love that it is tucked away in an alley and has all the lovely dark wood inside. Typical pub grub, the fish and chips was pretty good, not great, but I've come to accept that I will never have truly great fish and chips with mushy peas in the States. Once you've had it done right, there's just no comparison. Oh well, until I make it back to the U.K. and Ireland, I am happy to have the Irish Bank to tide me over.
author: Kari E.

description:
4 stars on having outdoor seating!!! in my mind this is the biggest draw of this spot. A whole alley that is open w/ tables, as in a sea of people awaits you around the corner from the dumpsters!! Enticing I know.

4 stars on the pouring a mighty stiff drink. Damn I was a bit tipsy after 2 and a basket of fries later. 

I embrace the Irish, I am part Irish great, yet fricken hell turn down the music in the bar. You can not hear the person u are sitting w/ and or next to. And those serving could be a tad bit more pleasant in lieu of just slinging a cocktail at you. I'm just saying. I come here, I like this place, it is just nice when you have some one else making the bar run!!

Pls note too, the same people have been coming here since god was a boy and I love that you can bring in your dog.  classic!
author: Nicole F.

description: Started off here for a pubcrawl on St. Paddy's day weekend. It was jam packed inside the bar, but luckily both sides of the alleyway it's in was closed off, which made for a nice drinking area. There was a band playing and the merry crowd was singing along with the songs. The only qualm I had was that beers were $7 apiece for that day.
author: Kim L.

description: Their food is amazing, and they have a decent whiskey list. I love their vegetarian curry, and their mashed potatoes! Their curry is spicy and there's always left overs. Best bar eats in town. I love going here on a nice day or night and sitting outside. Though their whiskeys are a little on the pricey side. I would generally give this place 3 stars, but their food is the additional star.
author: Amber G.

description:
Great place for a beer, nice staff...

We go here often, good food for lunch! You have to try the macaroni and cheese... Really incredible.
author: Jon M.

description:
Cool lil' pub tucked away in an alley.  Great history to the place, but honestly...I'm not so hot on it.  But a convienient FiDi after work spot. 
Sorry loyal Irish Bankers
author: Robby T.

description:
Oh, the confessional. I long to sit in there and it's always taken. Dammit!

The food is average pub food but it's great to sit outside in the alley on a nice day. Also, it's a great place for random celebrations of Irish holidays.
author: Ali L.

description:
I ALWAYS GET THE BLOODY MARY HERE.
mmmmmmmmmmmmm...

SO GOOD. you know how some places make their bloody marys a bit THINK and chunky? this place makes 'em FRESH and spicy! you can control the level of heat... the first time i got SPICY so it hurt my ears, but the second time i went i ordered medium so it was much better.  

the food is mediocre, though... once i got something with mashed potatoes and it tasted like the boxed type... i dont think it got cooked all the way because the texture was thick, dry, clumpy, and bland... like the kind they served in my elementary school. eeeeeeeeeeeew. 

but either way, the place is cute, always seating, and i had good times with good friends!
author: Rosa K.

description:
I went with my best Guinness-drinking-mate for lunch;... technically we had lunch at the sushi place next door but it wasn't anything special, and not nearly as satisfying as a proper pull of the black stuff!
It was world cup time, but a week day, and we still had a hard time securing a seat... it was worth it. It's hard to get a real feel for a pub at 2pm on a sunny day, but I think its worth another (several) visit(s).
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Hence another pub in SF.

Tucked away in an alley a block off of Kearny Street, on a Sunday night, we stumbled in after leaving Belden Lane.  Loved it.  Authentic, bright, warm and full of memorabilia on the walls.  

Good stiff drinks, cheap prices, and after the first Irish Coffee the bartender knew to bring me 6 packets of sugar for my drink.  Can't hate a place after that.
author: Denise B.

description:
The biggest problem with The Bank it is impossible to get to on a weekend like this, where a bunch of people desperate for a reason to drink will clog it up because they, for some reason, celebrate St. Pat's day and know that The Irish Bank has the word "Irish" in it.

Normally, most of these people stay away and you can sit outside in peace (alright, potentially crowded very loud peace) but the group is fun, the food is great, and the beer is delicious.  The servers and bouncer?  Hi guys - you're the best.  I've spent countless days here after work with friends and hope to spend countless more.

I just have to get past this weekend...
author: Max A.

description:
My new favorite spot to grab a beer and chill!

I came here many moons ago for St. Patty's Day, and had a sour first impression since it was just like a trashy outdoor frat party w/ access only to a teeny tiny room and my new suede shoes swimming in green beer.

BUT, I gave it a 2nd shot late last night for some post-work drinks w/ my co-workers and saw it at its best! I had no idea that during normal operating hours they set up a nice outdoor seating area in their Euro-like alleyway w/ heating fixtures and overhangs to keep you warm. The inside is also an inviting space with a few tables available if you're able to snag em'. The ones we sat at were made out of old sewing tables w/ pedals underneath! Nice touch!

Their fish and chips are the best I've had in a loong time. The fish was as fresh as it could get for being deep fried and the chips had a perfect crunch to em' w/out any fat, soggy ones hangin' around. The side of coleslaw could have had a little more flavor to it, but I was still very satisfied w/ it. 

Service was nice & quick and prices were reasonable.

I think I've met my match for a great go-to spot to unwind after work! (as long as it's not on St. Patty's Day!)
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I stopped in this pub whilst walking around Union Sq. on a Sunday. It's amazing how many businesses are closed on Sundays when you consider all the hungry peoples milling around... 
Anyway, my eating partner and myself ducked into this place hoping to be fed. It's always a nice surprise to find a hidden jewel within the city, and they didn't disappoint! 
Great Beef Stew!! Next time I'll try the outdoor seating. Situated in an alley, so you can get your Guinness on and be as loud as you want.
author: John R.

description:
3 1/2 stars, really.

Ample outdoor seating
Affable, if downright attractive and/or quirky, staff
Tasty burger, done just the way I asked.
Delicious steak fries.
Splendid quantities of cold beer.  I'm a big fan of Harp and Smithwick's on tap.
Generally pretty good crowd.  

YES!
author: Evan G.

description:
Cool Irish bar, great for Happy Hour in the Financial District. Kinda dark inside, but they usually have the alley outside blocked off, so it is fun to hang out there.

Edit: Apparently now they can't have more people outside than they have chairs outside. It is too dark and stuffy inside, so I'll nock down my rating. The place doesn't seem to have a consistent crowd, its been a bit hit and miss.
author: Ossama A.

description:
I like this place.  I imagine that on Marque nights that it is lame.  I like drinking at about 3 or 4 on the weekends and this is a cool place to do it.

Sitting in the ally with some friends, some beer and a HUGE plate of chicken strips.  Life doesn't get better.  It really doesn't.

There are not enough people that work here so the service is spotty.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Great Atmosphere, adequate food, good beer.
This would be a great place for beers after work, but I was underwhelmed by the cheeseburger I had.  That should have been pretty easy for an irish pub...
author: Zach T.

description:
I'm giving three stars for now because we only stopped in for a quick bite mid-afternoon on a Saturday. The fish and chips were a little too battered for me, but whoever invented blue cheese fries is a genius. What's especially glorious is that they're steak fries, so it's big hunks of fried potato with big hunks of pungent blue cheese... mmmmmmm. Unless you don't like blue cheese. In which case you should stay away.

Otherwise, the menu selection is straightforward pub grub. There's a cute little "phone booth" table, and "church pew" booths, and lots of Irish nostalgia on the walls -- kind of like Bucca di Beppo for the Irish crowd (i.e., lots of black and white, semi-lewd photos). There's also outside seating in the alley for the days when the SF chill hasn't totally taken over the city. Sounds like it's more a night destination, though, so I can't attest to that.
author: J C.

description:
Chimay for the man and  Boddy's for me...this place gets five stars for having a real Irishman behind the bar. 
A great happy hour joint with average bar grub.
author: Stacy T.

description:
Good atmosphere and I love that this place is tucked away in a little alley. Very European. I enjoyed a few pints and had some fish and chips. The fish was underseasoned. I kept adding salt because it was rather flavorless, even with tartar sauce. I thought the chips/fries were delicious.

I'd come here again but would order something different next time.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I've always liked The Irish Bank, even though it can be a bit over the top at times. I've never had a bad time there, at least not as far as I can remember. Bearing in mind of course, I don't remember all that much from most of my visits. Ha, that's not true. I remember everything!

But in all seriousness, The Irish Bank is a great place to take visiting guests. It's central location gives you other options in case you're in the mood to hit up a few places. No to mention all the great food in the area. I've always felt the bartenders were attentive & friendly enough. Generally I prefer a places that are more low-key. But for being a fairly trendy city watering hole, this place is alright! 

I especially love what they've done with the alley space, it's a definite plus for smokers, warm nights or for those who prefer beer garden atmospheres.
author: alexa c.

description: Hmm I usually don't think of great food when I am at a bar however Irish Bank has a great menu of  full goodies!  Set in a an alleyway close to the gates of Chinatown and the crowd that congregates is very eclectic.  I've hit this spots on different days and hours and you'll see the typical after hours Financial District "dudes" in their suits sitting right next to the burly, hairy, older man who is sitting right next to a group of faux hipsters.  I don't mean this in any derogatory way.... but just interesting.  I love the food here, the beer, and the atmosphere.  Great English Chicken Curry... yum!
author: Anne L.

description: An Irish pub, that really isn't an Irish pub. The Guinness posters and bar say Irish pub, but the menu says otherwise. Curry at an Irish pub? Food is mediocre. I tried the pork ribs and they were extremely dry and overdone. Should have tried something more "authentic" like the bangers or corned beef, but this still doesn't strike me as a place with very good food.
author: Ryan M.

description: First timer it was awesome the beer was fresh right of the tap the fries were delish and the service was out of this world
author: Sy H.

description:
Solid bar.  Had a few drinks with friends here...  very nice beer selection, and a good looking Scotch selection, though I didn't sample any :(.
I had corned beef and cabbage for dinner (as I feel obligated to at any Irish pub)...  it was very good.
Service was friendly and exceptionally fast.  Not a busy evening, but our average wait time between ordering a beer and receiving it was less than 2 minutes (sitting at a table outside ordering from a waitress, not directly from the bartender).
author: Sam B.

description: The atmosphere is great, very European with the tables to sit at outside. The beer selection is large and the food menu shows your classical Irish and other European dishes. The cured salmon and trout platter is a wonderful starter, the Bratwurst with Sauerkraut are fantastic. Service is very good, even though some confusion may occur. You can leave with a wonderful experience from there.
author: Erdmann R.

description:
Wow.

Love the alley location. And outside seating under a charming awning in the alley too. Great, positive crowd of good looking, down to earth SFers (I think we missed the frantic yuppies Ashton M. described). Beer selection is not the most extensive, but tasty. The burger is ENORMOUS. Extra kudos for having a website, and one that actually has information, at that. (I'm surprised at how many businesses have an empty website, like having a domain name is all they aimed for.) Takes plastic as well as cash. I'm certainly coming back.
author: Clar L.

description:
An impressive bar with a large outdoor space an a scotch list to match, that is until you start ordering things.  I had to order 5 different scotches just to get one that they had in stock.  The waiters didn't know what they had, and even the ones he recommended were out.

From experience, the first round comes out fast, but there might be some lag time between rounds after that.  I think the waiters are stretched to the limit here so they focus on pleasing the people ordering food.  If you're planning on a liquid dinner, you might have to saddle up to the bar to get your fill.
author: Jared B.

description:
I keep forgetting to review this place. My work, 1 block away, always seems to choose this place for "Going Away" happy hours for coworkers who are leaving the company (big company, happens often) so I just don't think of it when I review. I haven't had any food here so I'm just reviewing the bar and atmosphere.

Great selection of beers (yay for Smithwicks) and I love the fact that it's far back in the alley. Cute, feels like you're not in the financial district, which is exactly how I want to feel after a long day at work. 

Really nothing bad to say, but it's not like I'm showing up every night. A little too close to work to choose this as a destination for outside of work functions. Sorry, Irish Bank. Location, location, location.
author: Sarah P.

description:
A classic financial district bar!  Every once awhile you can spot some cute looking professionals here.  
Try to sit outside if you can, it's kinda stuffy inside.

Me like their fish n' chips. : )
author: N. C.

description:
Didn't have the food but had a pint or two of Leffe. They have a good selection of beer and wine. I was absolutely impressed. Getting a few options of Belgian beer is always a good thing in my eyes. 

The bar staff were very charming too. And knowledgeable...the bartender was able to recognize the name of my favorite beer and tell me a place in town to get it at. It's not easy to find at bars so I was grateful.
author: Lynn C.

description:
As the drunk girl who passed us called them, the "crack" fries were truly crack-tacular. And by crack, I mean melted blue cheese, and by melted blue cheese, I mean a serious punch in the mouth. Don't think you can eat a whole order of these by yourself because these fries are heavy! She ain't your sister! She actually really heavy!

We came especially to try the homemade macaroni and cheese, since M. and I are always trying to doctor it up at home and search for the best among restaurants. But I have to say the cheese part was sadly lacking the usual tang that a good dish of mac'n'cheese often delivers. It was much better after sprinkling on some of the plethera of blue cheese that made our fries so rich.

I also ordered lentil soup, although I don't know why since the beer, fries and mac'n'cheese (even sharing them!) were enough to fill my belly, so I got a to-go container right away and ate the soup the next day, also crumbling in some blue cheese from the leftover "crack" fries. Very tasty! I don't care what M. says about lentils lacking flavor. I love me a good and hearty lentil soup.

I need to make a more thorough run-through of the beer selection, though. :-) But it looks top notch!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Your average Irish bar, but I love Irish bars, so...

Went here for the first time this weekend.  Saw a movie downtown and had to find a place that served dinner late and lots of alcohol.  Ordered the BLT.  Came right quick (it was 10:30, so I'm pretty sure the kitchen wasn't very busy).  Bread freshly toasted, fresh veggies, and TONS of bacon made for a great BLT.  ALSO, mayo on the side?  Thanks, I appreciate that.  

Came with fries, which were pretty standard.  Honestly, I liked that there was a lot of bacon and that we got to sit outside in the alley.  Friends got a plain cheeseburger and chicken strips.  Greasy food?  Yes, but at 10:30 on a Saturday night, can't go wrong by that.  Way better than Denny's.  Wait staff also pretty nice.  Will probably find myself back there for drinks in the near future.
author: Leslie G.

description: This place was crackin on St. Patties day. Loud, fun, and crowded- just like every St. Patties day party should be. Music was pumpin all night with people even dancing in front of the pub. How can you not have a good time when your forced to dance with the person right next to you? Thats how you know a party is great- when your obligated to shake what yo mama gave ya!
author: David D.

description: Went here with a large group of friends during a 'Sunday Funday' - we're from Sacramento but we had a local guy with us who walked us here from our hotel. The alleyway patio seating was charming and fun and our sever was very patient and nice to us. (A younger girl so she joined in on a lot of our laughing and joking). We all ordered a variety of different items from the menu so I was able to try and see a lot of the dishes. I ordered the BLT and it was horrible - only a few over cooked painfully crunchy pieces of bacon on some stale barely toasted dry bread. However I ended up eating from a few friends' plates and the calamari was good, blue cheese fries, chicken strips, fish and chips, all alright and I heard the kielbasa and sour kraut was delicious. The server did forget one of the club sandwiches we ordered but made up for it with two free beers. Boyfriend ordered the Cesar salad and it was pretty small, chicken was a little overcooked but he probably didn't make the wisest choice ordering a salad at a place like that.  It's definitely food from an Irish kitchen, I've never been impressed by such so it was on par with my low expectations at least.
author: Nicolette R.

description: Came in here on a late Sunday night when the rest of downtown seemed deserted. It was warm and welcoming and actually had a fairly good sized crowd inside. The bar tender took a little while to acknowledge our presence but not that big of a deal. I'm definitely coming back, perfect for a cozy drink and a quiet talk (on Sunday anyway).
author: Eva E.

description: I like the Irish Bank for its location -- it's always like a treasure hunt until I pop upon it unexpectedly. The fries are yummy. Went by for a drink last night and sat outside in the freezing cold waiting FOREVER to get a menu. The waitress kept walking by us, making eye contact, and then walking the other way. Um. Hello?
author: Vandana M.

description:
Well I went there the day after St Patty's day and I am sorry if you partied a little to hard but thats not my problem. 

Drinks order was forgotten

Food order was forgotten

Then had to wait a long time for the check.
author: Michael T.

description:
Fish and chips was DELICIOUS.  Something special about the dipping sauce.  I will go back there for this meal alone!

Of course, also typical nice Irish Pub stuff - cozy, bartender with charming accent, proper beers on tap.

Was a nice place to have an impromptu bday celebration with 8 people.
author: Patrick P.

description:
The new owners of the Irish Bank have made great improvements to the place. Perfect Pints of Guinness. Feels like a traditional Irish pub from Donegal, and I have been to a few. Was a fun place to watch the World Cup. 

Great outdoor space, now with awnings and heaters. 

If you work downtown it is a great for lunch and after work for a drink or two, or on the weekends a good break from the madding crowds of Union Square. 

Food has improved since the change of ownership and the staff quite friendly. With a real friendly red headed Bartender.

Well was just here last weekend for Bastille Day the music was good and the staff was great as always.
author: Kenny D.

description:
I mean-- it's the BANK, after all. How can you not give it 5 stars...?

Been coming here for years and years and just can't seem to break the habit. The curry fries, the black and tans.... the portraits of weird old Irish people on the walls... yup. Dig it.

And hurrah! They've redone the women's bathroom. The hand dryer-thingy gave me wind-burn. Suuuper strong.
author: Jen F.

description:
And Irish Pub that celebrates Bastille Day?  OK, whatever, so long as a lot of people have another excuse to get smashed!  ha ha

Not a bad place to visit in the afternoon, but it gets a little too crowded for me in the evening.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I like this place. Decent food, beer, outdoor seating... what more could you ask for?

We reserved the back room for a party and the staff was VERY accommodating and friendly.
author: Brad C.

description:
Is it REALLY the cheapest Chimay around at $5.50???

If it's not, it's okay... I still like coming here for my Chimay's!

It gets crowded with financial district people around happy hours weekdays... so crowded you can barely squeeze through the crowds sometimes!

But the bar itself is fun and quaint.  A lot of Irish memorabilia crap on the walls.  Wooden booths in the back (I still haven't gotten to sit in the little cubby-hole one!  It's cute!).

This is just a good place for a beer and catching up with someone.
author: Kitty O.

description:
I randomly ended up at this restaurant after shopping in Union square.  Entered through an alley, into the restaurants Back door, which was a tad bizarre, but interesting.  There are two parts: the Bar and Dining are.  Defintely a casual ambience....great place to chit chat with friends. The service was acceptable...hey its a Pub, not fine dining. 

Perks: You can sit wherever you want, if there are tables.  Lengthy selection of beer.  Small, but enough menu selections (good if you're indecisive).

Burgers are darn good, along with the chicken strips.  But I suggest steering away from the Blue cheese fries.  I love blue chesse, but here, the fries drown in it.
author: Anne K.

description:
This place is alright. Don't sit outside in the back. The wind brings the stench of garbage and sewage through there time-to-time and it's unpleasant to say the least. I felt like I was gonna lose my diner a couple times.
The French fries were great! They brought out mayonnaise for the fires. This was new to me. It turned out pretty good. I wasn't too keen on the vinegar for them though. I also enjoyed the turkey club sandwich. 
Service was decent. It wasn't spectacular.... But it did the job, we ate.
author: Michael F.

description:
bad service- we are talking sighs, eyes rolling, rushing us to order and saying "i'll just come back' within 5 seconds. BAD waitress! maybe her cat died. who knows.
great food
not bad beer selection. I'd like more!
author: Maryam M.

description: Ate here a year ago for lunch. I can't understand why curry is on the menu at an Irish bar. I am also tired of the whole Hallmark Corp "crappy Irish pub in a box" decor. Beer was reasonably priced, food was not. Both were good.
author: Lorrie K.

description: Came here to meet up with my friends from SF. Turned out to be a great venue since we were able to get a large table outside. Great beer selection and good service. Great for groups. Recommended!
author: Garett N.

description:
After working near the Buena Vista for quite a few years. I got used to trying Irish Coffees at different places.

I have to say, with this cold weather, my Pops and I stopped here and the Irish Coffee far surpassed the Buena Vista. The taste was great. When we got to the bottom, the sugar was on the bottom and it was awesome! Just the way it should be.

I would recommend The Bank to anyone who wants a great Irish Coffee.

For a cool pub, this is a great recommendation as well. Smithwick's, Guinness and Boddington's on tap. How can you go wrong? Fish & Chips rock too.
author: Chris B.

description:
Budvar on tap!!  It's called Czechvar, but that's not Budvar's or the Irish Bank's fault.

Felt kind of touristy on a Saturday afternoon, but what doesn't in this part of town?  It didn't really seem like my kind of place, and the pints were expensive, but I'll deal with it for a good Czech pint every now and then.
author: Megan D.

description:
I'll admit Irish bars are a bit annoying to me for the following reasons:

1. Music in the Jukebox (not saying I hate it, just not my first choice).
2. Crowded.
3. Always that Belligerent jackass you want to pop.
4. I end up drinking Jameson and get way to cocky.

Well, this place wasn't bad!  We got a seat outside, service was friendly, and I heard Gypsy Kings playing inside.  The one downer = Belligerent jackass I wanted to pop.
author: Justin C.

description:
One very big star for the Blue Cheese fries.  

One big star that it's outside with heaters and you can smoke if you so choose.  

One big star for the quite large selection of beers.

Minus two stars for the fact that the cheaper beers are still $5.50.  Just watch your wallet here, you can't drink like you would elsewhere and get away with a cheap bill.  $1.50 more per beer than most places starts to add up.  Talk about sticker shock!
author: Jessica B.

description:
We first checked this place out, because one of the people from Virginia Tech used to have a stake in the place.  It's a pretty cool place, with outside seating tucked in the alley and quite a bit in indoor seating.  Their draft list is great.  I've eaten a meal here once; they made me turkey rueben :-)  I really like their french fries.  You can get them covered in blue cheese and/or get a side of curry sauce.  

So why just three stars?  Well, the waiter service just sucks.  When a group comes in and sits at a table, the waiter should not be glaring at you.  He really copped an attitude the entire night.  Every time we needed a new beer, we had to physically get his attention.  Another time, a waiter never came to take our drink order.  So we ordered at the bar.  The bartender asked where we were sitting, told us to sit back down, and then transferred the order to the appropriate waiter.  Well, those drinks just sat at the bar.  We ended up going up and getting them ourselves.  Then, whoever our crappy waiter was, realized that the drinks were missing, and put in another (duplicate) order. I mean, it's a frickin bar.  You make your money on tips.  Your tips are based on sales.  Why don't you want to deliver the goods?!

One last thing.  Be sure to use the hand dryer in the bathroom.
author: Jory R.

description:
This is your perfect neighborhood bar... to go to after work with your coworkers... ok, so those dont always go together, but here for some reason they do. 

Good pub food... friendly staff... quick drinks... 

Plus... lots of outdoor seating in the alley (though I have to admit being a bit skeeved out being taken down an alley the first time I went there)
author: Jordan Y.

description:
The one thing that would make this place perfect is if the building next door to the Bank was moved so that they had more sun in the alley (though the lack of sun does add to the Irish ambiance).

The pints are good and reasonable, the staff is hot and friendly, and their bar food is the yummy bar food standard for the City (I especially love a basket of chicken fingers once I've had one too many Guinnesses or Chimays).

Also, this is THE place for fish and chips, in my admittedly limited opinion.  I love coming here on Saturday or Sunday afternoons for a quiet pint and a basket of fried ocean goodness!

I love the tumble down decor, the weird quarter sink in the men's toilette and the super-duper hand dryer.

I suppose that I have been going there for years it just becomes a habit, but, it is pleasant habit at that!
author: Jim K.

description: Smithwick's and Boddingtons on tap. Skip the ripoff food and stay on a liquid diet here.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I love this place! It's the best spot for lunch with a mid-day beer. I had the best BLT I have ever had in San francisco at the Irish Bank. The sandwich usually comes with American Cheese, but I asked for blue cheese (which I have never had on a BLT before) and it was just AMAZING! The fries are crispy and the Lagunitas IPA is obviously good! Made for the perfect mid-week break from work. I'll be back (in a Swartzenager voice).
author: Casi C.

description:
pretty cool spot, downtown, that i had never heard of before. they have a whole block(alley) of outdoor-seating, which was awesome. the service was quick and attentive. drinks were, apparently, pretty good. but i just had a beer. the food was delicious. i absolutely HATE bleu-cheese dip, but i decided to try some of Tatyana's bleu-cheese fries. they were AMAZING!! the mac & cheese was very good, and overall, portions were HUGE. 

a couple things prevent me from giving this place more than 3 stars. the prices were pretty high, for just about everything. also, the bill was sorted out in ridiculous fashion. it's cool to give us one bill, but can you at least show us what we ordered?!? instead, the bill read "$80+ for drinks" and "$70+ for food". um, hi, we're a group of 10... also, they had a "vip" room with complete dorks. zero "talent"...
author: Andrew T.

description: Interesting pub in an alleyway. Fairly lively around mid-day on a Thursday, imo. Had a Widmer Hefeweizen ($5.50) while my friend had a Guinness ($6.00). Apparently, I am not one for Guinness as that stuff is stronggg. Clean facility, low key, everyones kind of doing their own thing. I'd visit again if I were in the area. Wish they served Blue Moon. :/
author: Sara T.

description: This is the best pint of Guinness in the city! I know a pint when i see one since I lived in Cork for a year and had my fair share of pints.... The outdoor seating is great when we have nice warm nights in sf. I haven't had any of the food so the 4-stars is purely for the Guinness...
author: Ben B.

description: best Irish pub in the city..... at least that I have been to. food is just good old pub food, there mashed potatoes I think is 70% butter =) yum! And plenty of out door seating. Good atmosphere, reasonably priced, good pub food, plenty of beer, great place to go with a group of friends. I would give it 3 and a half stars, but its not a 4 star place, so Irish bank gets 3. Go check it out if you have not been yet.
author: Damien B.

description:
Probably the best after-work spot in the Financial District, but the food is mediocre, the service could be better, and- biggest reason for not getting a fourth star- no happy hour drink specials.  

Outside seating is the way to go.  

Get me a $3 pint and I'd never leave.
author: Scott N.

description: Went here with a larger group and when I called LONG BEFORE making reservations they said seperate checks were fine and wouldn't pose a problem. The waitress "did us a favor" splitting our checks and holding our credit cards hostage while we ate. She also made it seem like we should be lucky to eat there. The food was great drinks fine though mine missed the mark. The waitress to be spiteful gave lots of pennies back to one person as change. She needs an attitude adjustment. If it weren't for her and the owner being not so friendly this place would've received a 4.
author: Tabitha F.

description:
Damn good place for a draft and a jamesons.  The fish & chips are mighty fine and generous enough to share with a friend.  Lively most nights and I love that this is only a 1/2 block from where I work. 
 Good service save the cheerless busboy...almost bought him a drink of his own.
author: jules m.

description:
I went last night for Saint Patty's and when I got there, I wish I hadn't. I basically had to wade through masses of sorority and fraternity sluts and jocks to get to the inside, where the floor was sopping wet from spilled beers and people were pushy and grabby (yes, I do mean grab-ass). I actually had some guy spit on me, looking entirely inebriated and out of sorts. I sympathized however and let it go. But seeing girls in basically ass-less skirts and tall boots with no hose, well it made me go - Ho! It was ridiculous. Not to mention the music was terrible ; techno, rap, pop, etc. As soon as the majority of my friends arrived we exited the premises and went to another smaller bar for the rest of the evening. I do prefer close company over rushing sweating bodies, at least those attached to obnoxious green wears.  

I have been here before on their usual nights and it is so much more laid back and the beers aren't so ridiculously priced. But being Saint Patty's there was even a cover charge and the beers were outrageous. 

But hey, it happens. I do prefer my dive bars.
author: Lydia H.

description:
I have to give five stars to a place that lets you order two drinks and then sit in the empty dining room on a Sunday afternoon so you and your coworker/ soon to be boyfriend (now ex) can have a hard core make out and grope session. 
I love Stella Artois and they have it on tap. The burgers are hella bomb, the fries are good, and the chicken strips are good as well. 
Used to go there w/ girlfriends and people after work, nothing like getting your buzz on and smoking outside midweek. The only weird thing is that you have to pay for your drinks inside, separately from your food. It makes no sense, but whatever, take out cash beforehand and go with it. Seriously, scamming on taboo men in empty dining rooms and belgian beer? what more could you ask for? 
Downside, tends to get really crowded so sometimes hard to sit inside or get a table outside.
author: Lacey P.

description:
Go here to splurge. Cuz you will. On the Blue Cheese Fries. You'll be happy you did.
 
While some girlie girls might choose to perch their stiletto'd selves atop a trendy bar stool and order a cosmo for Happy Hour, I say BRING IT when I hear a proposal for a seat outside, Jameson on the rocks and some gourmet grease. Why not absorb that hangover as you create it? Happy. Hour.
author: catalina g.

description: Irish accents Irish whiskey and guiness....$8 a beer is a little steep for me though....ok place
author: Michael I.

description: You can't go wrong with a good ole Irish pub. But if there's anything that separates the Bank from its other Irish competitors, it's their staple cocktails. Bloody Mary topped with Guinness and their grapefruit cosmopolitan. Good for parties (indoor and outdoor seating) and large groups. Nice spot to check out on Bastille day.
author: Alex H.

description: Great place to have a beer after work with friends. I don't think I have even been inside because the alley kick ass.
author: Tony N.

description: I came here on St. Pattys, first on my lunch break, and then later that evening. When I came on my lunch break it was super fun and they had a fun irish band! It totally got me into the St. Pattys mood. However, when we tried to come later that night it was completely ridiculous and trashy, and there was a cover? Ew. No.  Especially since I couldn't think of a good enough reason to pay the cover. This is definitely the kind of place to come during the day when it's sunny!
author: Sonya D.

description: Introduced to this place by my friend that use to live above this joint. It's a very cozy bar, with loads of decor on the walls. The night we went, it was packed, so the place was incredibly hot! We had to step out a few times to cool down. Patrons of this place seem to be from the older crowd (35+), but everyone was really chill. Overall experience was great, and I would revisit.
author: Jessica C.

description: Stumbled across this bar late on a Monday night.  It was actually pretty empty (but it was a Monday after Christmas) but it has a great atmosphere, a no non-sense bartender (accent and all) and a very fitting juke box.  Didn't actually have any food but there were plenty of great beers to choose from and overall had a very unexpected but fun time.  If you're looking for a good ol' Irish pub which plenty of ambiance and warmth this is the place.  I am not a resident of SF but I'll be sure to stop back in the next time around.
author: Holly H.

description:
need a place to unwind after work in the fidi? look no further! clamor up to benches and tables on the patio or hustle inside if you are having bad weather (like today, wtf SF?). heifewisen + cheddar cheese fries makes for an excellent way to spend an evening. 

burgers are good too when you are in the mood for one and don't feel like going to mcdonalds (ew). 

gotta love all the true irish people working here - makes me feel like i stepped out of SF and into a bar in dublin.
author: laura f.

description:
first, i have to admit, pretty much any establishment that serves beers and can accommodate my crew o' troublemakers works for me. (we sit around wondering why our partners put up with us. and then when said partners txt or call us, we try to act sober as we skeddadle home...)

second, i love those little alleyway seating spots downtown. even if the afternoon/evening wind is picking up, i'll hunker down and enjoy the ambiance for as long as i can feel my fingers clutching my pint.

third, a pub with good beers. no frou-frou drinks that'll give me a wicked hangover. just pint after pint of good beers. 

so next time those lazy troublemakers wanna hang out, i'd be more than happy to while away the hours here. at least till my hunny txts and tells me to get myself back on home...
author: eliza w.

description: Love Irish Bank. I came often here for early morning World Cup games and always for after work drinks. The staff is incredibly friendly and they have a great beer selection. I'm a fan ;)
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I've been here once before and visited again tonight. Incredibly warm evening and sitting at the outside tables was just perfect. Met some cool people and tried some new beers that I also enjoyed. A mellow, fun atmosphere with music that's nice to listen to, but still easy enough to have a conversation and not yell. I suggest ordering the British/Irish items on the menu as I have yet to go wrong, but others getting a burger were a little underwhelmed.

Grab a Boddington's and have some fun!
author: Jay U.

description: Spent many a happy hour here....and lunch hour too! Ignore the dumpsters and enjoy the awesome food.  Irish Bank hooked me on Shepherd's Pie.
author: Amelia C.

description:
These guys know what they're doing, who they are and how to be the one thing every place strives for:  consistent!

Great selection of Irish whiskeys and beers and the food is just right on cold San Francisco days.  Bangers and mash, stew and fish 'n' chips all go down well when you're supposed to be at the office.
author: MJ M.

description:
The Irish Bank is tucked away in an alleyway and is way more than a stop on a pub crawl during St. Patty's Day.

Sure its fun on the day when everyone is an Irishman but its a cool place other days too. The bar is pretty long so there's always a spot to mosey on up and get a Guiness Extra Cold (which they serve properly by not letting you get your grubby hands on it before it settles.) There's a good amount of tables and chairs to sit and lounge and talk about the works of George Bernard Shaw or Bono or just that pretty lass you have your eyes on...

Food actually isn't too bad. I actually used to love getting the fish n chips and sitting outside at the alleyway tables.

It can be hit or miss some nights but a fun place. There was always something I thought was funny and cool when the crew would call my friends and I "lads"..
author: R P.

description:
I always have to enjoy at least a Harp or Guinness at The Irish Bank when I visit San Francisco....something about going down an alley to get into a bar.

I think the food is actually quite good for a bar....fish and chips, rueban sandwich, blue cheese fries....all great with a tall one.

The crowd is sometimes questionable....I guess I always expect a more upscale crowd based on it's location, but have never had any issues.
author: Mark C.

description:
A few times here and counting.

Highlights
*Great place for groups
*Good beer selection
*Good pub food
*Great atmosphere
*Outside seating
*Happy Hour
*Irish themed
*Chill bouncer named Mark

The Bad
*Too crowded outside
*Small bathroom
*Food priced a tad high
*Use to be a bank (come on... I have to balance pros & cons)
*I can't think of anything else
*2 more  points to balance out pros & cons
*1 more  point to balance out pros & cons
*Now it's balanced, but isn't that a good thing?

I've been here for a company party.  It was a great time because the booze was free.  Every time I've bene here it has been with a group and I'd recommend bringing your crew.
author: Po L.

description:
Working in the financial district, there are not many fun places to go within a few blocks after work, so the Irish Bank has become my go-to.  The other day I did the following three things at the same time:

-Drank two pints of Red Hook
-Watched the Red Sox play the Yankees on one flat screen
-Watched premiership soccer on the other flat screen

All while having a casual conversation with a co-worker.

That to me is an ideal bar experience.
author: Alex H.

description:
I work close by and decided to break in the new associate by taking him to The Bank. As we walked down the alleyway off of Grant, he wondered if  I was taking him to somewhere safe. I assured him that all was alright and two hours later.... his fears melted away.  

Somewhat hidden and as always a fun place to get your drink on outside.
author: S L.

description:
Goddamn those are some good french fries.

I like skinny fries just as much as the next girl (what's wrong with fried potatoes?  Nothing.  Ever.), but in my heart I'm a steak fry lover.  And Irish Bank provides.  In a big way.  A big ol' basket way.  Those things are delicious.  And the perfect end to a hellish week of doing whatever soul-sucking work you may do downtown.

I have had a burger there, and it was decent.  But really, this is a gorgeous weather, happy hour kind of place.  I love the total lack of attitude, the heavy booze drinks, and, of course, the fries. 

The ups: fries, booze, outdoor seating, reasonable prices.
The downs: at times slow service, crowds, and an inordinate number of sqeezy frat-boys-turned-three-piece suits.

Go chill, be yourself, enjoy drinks with friends, and go home drunker and fatter than you could at other bars downtown.
author: Eliza L.

description:
The Good:
The food is great! Everything I've had on the menu is well done. The fish & chips are fresh and the shepherd's pie is tasty (if not a little small.) The waitstaff is pretty good at timely and friendly service.

The not so Good:
Do *not* sit at the bar if you're interested in service. The bartenders really do not pay any attention to customers sitting at the bar if they are at all busy. I waited a good 8-10 minutes trying to get a food/drink order in at the bar while the getting passed over for the incoming drink orders from the waitstaff. Try to get a table outdoors or in the "dining room" next to the room with the bar.

I live very close to the Irish Bank so it's a good option off-hours for me and I'll continue to go back--as long as it's not busy. I've learned to walk in, gauge how busy they are and walk right out if there is a bit of a crowd.
author: Brian H.

description: Good ambiance with a chill crowd. Nothing too noteworthy besides the outdoor area, but I have yet to see it at night.
author: Haz O.

description: Great place for fish, chips, and a beer.  Love the atmosphere inside.  Love grabbing a seat in the alley as well.  Definitely worth a stop if you are in the area.
author: Matt G.

description:
The smell of rotting beer in an alley really takes me back to some point in my life that I would rather not journey back to...
The pours were generous and the macaroni and cheese might be the best that I have ever had.  (Quite the connoisseur of mac and cheese, not to toot my own horn.)  The rest of our meal wasn't fabulous.  The service was a bit slow, but friendly.  I got quite a chill in the alley even with the heaters.  I recommend bringing a thick coat, as the wind tends to funnel down the alley in a wicked way.

I will definitely return and try sitting inside next time.

*****
I have been back several more times.  Find a table inside...it feels like a European pub (sans smoke.)  Good times!
author: Mackenzie O.

description:
If you have a soft spot for real Irish or British pubs, this is the place for you.  I swear (although it could be wishful thinking/my imagination) that whenever I go in there I hear a friendly accent from across the pond.

So, the food's good, but not great and they have a nice selection of beers. If you're a fan of hard cider, which isn't easy to find in most bars, it's nice to know that you can get a pint here as well.

It'd be nice if they had a bit more seats in the front part or at least always had seats outside.
author: Vikki P.

description: Checked this place out on a Friday - full of the after work crowd; good place for a good beer and a chat. Didn't realize they have an outdoor screen set up, but that might've been special for the World Cup. Many people, but we were still able to get seats at the bar and drinks quickly.
author: Vicki L.

description: Curry is usual fare in English or Irish Pubs since the days of India being an English Crown Colony. Many Indians have emigrated to the UK and Ireland over the years and as such, curry has become a staple not only in pubs, but in English and Irish kitchens as well.
author: Brad P.

description: Cheers to the Irish Bank, a true gem of a pub in the heart of San Francisco.  It's tucked away in an alley just around the corner from Union Square with a terrific outdoor sidewalk cafe.  I love the vibe at the Irish Bank. And when it's chilly or the guys are in the mood for a game, the indoor bar and restaurant are always hoppin,  friendly, and authentically Irish.   If you're craving  fish  and chips, you won't be disappointed.  So up with the glass, and down with the beer!
author: Zen M.

description: Indoor seat, outdoor seats.  Oh my the options!  Drinks could have been stronger, but for the price you get what you pay for.  Wasn't too crowded which is always nice.  Was there even music?  I definitely like watching chicks school their boyfriends for checking out hotter chicks (like me).  I'm getting a little too cocky, but sorry ladies, maybe you should let go of the their leashes a little and lighten up!
author: Justine D.

description:
Greasy food and an extremely rude waiter with a real attitude problem.

This place would've been ok if it wasn't for the Fawlty Towers-like service.
author: Pastor Z.

description: I have been here a couple of times. It is a great place to get drunk if that is your goal. I have found that you can either sit at the bar and get your ugly face on or you can go to the back room and chat with friends. It is always a good crowd and is not to far from Bart and other transportation.
author: Peter W.

description: A genuine Irish pub...that is, overheated,good booze selection,crap food,soccer. The otter reviews here pretty well cover the description. If you adore Irish pubs,give it a try.
author: martha S.

description: Came here with some coworkers for lunch since its Friday and we couldnt eat meat. Looked online and they have an extensive food menu! Who would have known! We all had the fish and chips, the fish pieces were huge and fried goodness and the fries were thick and salted just right. We sat outside because all the seating inside was taken!!! Good food will be back.
author: Julie F.

description: Love it here! only have been here once so far, but had a blast! went yesterday for st pattys festivities! Fun block party with a band and everything! I love bars that have an outside area. I loved the inside of this bar too, so cozy and and cool looking inside! Great crowd of people too. I will definitely be back a bunch, love it! Prices of drinks not too bad at all. I would love to have dinner here sometime also.
author: Chrissy A.

description: This is a great little spot to have a beer and relax. The food is good and of course the beer is too. The night we came in there was a rowdy bachelorette group and they accommodated us. I will be back for sure. I would like to sit outside next time since it was raining when we were there last.
author: Melinda R.

description: Came here on a Tuesday!!! Sat at the Bar. The bartenders are very friendly!! Enjoyed the atmosphere. I had my first Irish car bomb here!!! Which was very tasty!!! The Fish and Chips are also pretty good. Not greasy at all.  Very Low key place.  If your not a beer drinker you should not go there. Great place to just hang out. This place is located in a alley which i thought was pretty cool!
author: Lourdes G.

description: A solid standby with a cozy outside area sandwiched between 2 tall buildings in downtown SF.  The service was very good; the food was.. well, pub food quality- it lacked a bit of taste and the sausage tasted like a giant hot dog (really).  The spirits were great tho- good place to hang out and have a drink if you're not overly concerned about having a gastronomical experience.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Wow. It's a completely different experience here when it's NOT St. Patrick's Day and I AM wearing clothing. That's what I said to Capital R and (newly elite) Jason K this evening when we happened into The Irish Bank on our quest for meat and beer. 

We got there around 6 and were able to grab a table in the cute back room. Matt and I had fabulous big burgers, cooked good and rare, just like I like my dead animals on buns ($9). The green salad ($2 additional w/burger) was a lovely organic spring mix, lightly dressed to perfection. Matt and (newly elite) Jason's fries were so good I ate all of them and then, in the middle of my screaming foodgasm, spilled a whole bottle of ketchup all over myself. Yes, it was that good! I suggest a full-body napkin if you intend to get as excited about the food as I did. Because if you do get that excited, and you do spill ketchup all over yourself, from your knees to your neck, you will be shit out of luck when you get to the restroom and find out they don't have paper towels and you are forced to clean your expensive clothes off with toilet paper, which leaves white paper pills all over your black cashmere sweater and gray suit pants. 

Lots of beer but only a handful of wines mean you should probably come with a hankering for ale or a flexible attitude in terms of the wine menu. For three of us, the bill was about $60 with tip. That was for two burgers, a turkey club (which I also ate a lot of- thank you, newly elite Jason K), a glass of wine, and two beers. Not ridiculously cheap but a hot deal in the fidi. I'll be back. In fact, I may go back later tonight for another burger. It was really that good.
author: Autumn K.

description:
IRISH BANK

Great location, great beer, lively indoor space and a great alley for drinking and dining, so it's unfortunate that THE SERVICE SUCKED SO HARD.  

Last night, a buddy and I went for beers to celebrate the end of a hard-fought semester.  We sat in the alley talking about writing, travel and how to make money in questionably scrupulous ways.  It would have been a great way to kill time before dinner, if only the beer had been served without MASSIVE LAG TIME between rounds.  

I got my first drink at the bar, and the woman tending was sweet, funny, quick and pulled a good pint (she saved this from being a one-star review), but when we started ordering rounds at the table, this TOTAL SCHMUCK OF A SERVER was so completely worthless and rude.  It took so long for the first round to arrive that we intentionally ordered our second round before the first glass hit the table. Apparently he didn't believe us and seemed so shocked when much later he next sauntered by to discover that our glasses were empty, and YET HE STILL DIDN'T RUSH THE ORDER.  Five minutes later he was literally snapping his fingers and strutting back and forth along the alley and then he stopped to chat with some of his ugly friends.  Somebody else, bless his little heart, finally brought out round two, and the third round was a similar sort of spectacle, as was getting the check, but I will spare you the details.

If you go Irish Bank, and your server is this greasy, sketchy looking dark haired guy with a beard and Alice (as in Wonderland) tattooed on his forearm, JUST GET UP AND WALK AWAY.

I will go back, because I like the location and the crowd and I realize that it was only one person who spoiled my experience, and I will revise my review if I get a server with even basic competency, but this guy really spoiled the start of a great evening.
author: Quinn S.

description: Proof that there are too few outdoor drinking holes in the City. What could be better than sucking down a hefeweizen in a blocked-off downtown alley on a gorgeous afternoon? The Bank never disappoints. Oh, and for you agoraphobes, one can park it inside, but it feels pretty tight in there even when not at capacity.
author: Gregor G.

description: 6 of  us showed  up tonight based upon the Yelp reviews.  And as usual, the Yelpers are a  pretty  knowledgeable bunch!  Beers came quick, food came quick (and was quite good).  Everyone was friendly, including the bouncer.  We especially liked the bangers.  And you have to love  the outdoor seating, too.  Great place and we will be back.
author: Mike M.

description:
I love the Irish Bank. It's good food and a well stocked bar. Also, the space is just amazing. When you go you have the option of sitting outside in the very well decorated and heated alley, inside at the bar, or, if you're with the young ones, at the attached restaurant space.

The fish and chips are delicious. So is the trout/samon/ and-some other-fish on bread thingy. 

If you're a martini drinker, you might want to check out this place. They have the largest martini glasses ever. And if you like them dirty, then this is definitely the place for you. They make them so dirty (me being the person who usually asks for extra olive juice on the side) sometimes you have to ask them to tone them a bit. But just a bit.

As far as whiskies go. Great selection of single malts. Only problem: last time I was there I asked for a Glenmorangie with 3 rocks. What I got was the equivalent of a half shot. WTF?! It's an $8 drink, I expect to get a decent sized shot. I should have asked for a bit more, but I thought, meh. It was still early and I new I was going out later anyway.

So why not 5 stars? The service kind of sucks. Sorry. I hate to say it and I really would love to give them 5 stars, but so many times I've found myself waiting on one side of the bar while the bartender is just hanging out at the other end and I have to walk my ass over there to get his fucking attention. Come on. Wake up damn it. And about those martinis, I once waited about 10 min for the bartender to make me one. I said "dirty kettle, please" and he says, "ok" and then he disappeared.  If he had to go down to the cellar or whatever cuz they were out of olives or something, then at least let me know. I don't want to have to stand there like an idiot wondering where the bartender went. If it wasn't for the size of the glass, I might have never bothered again.
But the waiter is the worst. That's why I try to avoid sitting in the restaurant. He's just so rude. I mean, I can understand you're having an off day or whatever, but it's every fucking time. And it wasn't just me, people I've been there with have also pointed that out. The other waiters and waitresses have always been great though. It's just the little guy. I've only seen him inside. He's so mean.

BTW, CC is $10 min at the bar
author: Carla P.

description:
any place that has macallan cask strength gets 5 stars.

if you aren't into beer or whiskey, i don't think this place will appeal.  luckily, i am, so i had a great time
author: Steve S.

description: Best Mac "n" Cheese in the city.  Hands down.  My co-workers and I frequent this establishment after work.  The chicken strips are large and in charge as well.  I don't know if I would order anything else... and it's really only a after work kind of place, but the staff is always happy to see us and super accommodating to our needs.
author: amanda v.

description: Not business travel friendly.  Did not want to split check and made it difficult.  Food was par to blah.  Cool bar vibe though.  Kids seated in restaurant area.
author: Michael B.

description: The Irish Bank, not just for St. Patrick's Day anymore! Also for HH with the girls after work, and for getting free 401K fund advice from financial advisers.
author: Gretchen T.

description: the irish bank...really a pub...the afterwork hours are bustling....interior and outdoor seating cramp and full....serving up variety of $5 premium brew on tap..from guinness to chimay...irish bank serves up good brew....and serving bar food to fill the tummy....similar to the beldon lane set up.....alleyway pub in the city....
author: Hen A.

description: An Island oasis of Green .... Surrounded by an ocean of beer!  A wondrous escape down to 10 Mark Lane. A rare dark alley that leads to treasure in SF. A bank indeed... deposit friends and a bit of cash to withdraw good times and fun memories. Go open an account today.
author: Mark B.

description: I want to really love Irish Bank.  I do.  Maybe it's because I'm part Irish, or just because I'm an alcoholic (redundant), but you want to love Irish pubs.  Even fake, posuer Irish pubs.  Even when they're overly crowded, inexplicably expensive, with poor service.  But eventually, no matter how hard you stroke that blarney stone (warning: may make you go blind), you can't deny that the hype just doesn't live up to the actual experience.  The food is pedestrian in both selection and execution.  The drinks are neither overly generous nor moderately priced.  The place is packed.  Thus, with true sorrow, you look at your friends and say "I'm going to Murphy's."
author: Ben P.

description:
i admit one of the only reasons why i go back to this place time and again is because my office is practically the next block over, i have a lot of british friends who like to show up unannounced for a pint, i used to live in england, and i have a thing for black and tans after work.

otherwise, this place is filled with khaki, buttoned-down shirt types whose idea of conversation is one filled with sentences that start with, "i don't understand you women..." and "why is it that a woman always..."

....

dear god, please make them leave me alone. i just want to drink my guinness/bass half-breed and listen to the drone of irish folk songs and u2 playing in the background. if i had wanted conversation, i would have acknowledged their existence. i don't suppose telling someone their breath smells like they haven't brushed in days is something jesus or bono would have done.

the food has gone downhill except for the chips with curry sauce. still pretty tasty. i wouldn't eat the fish and chips nor touch the shepherd's pie because they can't get the proportions right on the batter and gravy. you can't go wrong with the burger and chips though. hard to mess that one up.

oh, and the servers can't add so double check your bill. we were being overcharged by $12.
author: May T.

description: I like pubs. What's more, I like pubs that serve strong, inexpensive drinks w/good quality alcohol. Having said that, finding a place situated in Union Square where you can basically get those two things is fabulous. Granted, they're not exactly cheap, but their price for Jameson is relatively good. I love the outside seating area, very reminiscent of Europe. The bathrooms are clean, the bartenders are friendly, and the ambiance is very comfortable. This is a great place to meet up with friends and just shoot the shit.
author: Veronica W.

description: If this is their idea of a bank, the Irish are FUCT.
author: Patrick A.

description: load my pint up my darlin cause this is a great drinking ho' -however crowded for the "after work" want -nanna-bes...great place to discuss the ugly meaning of life.  Womans restroom is too small and its not nice to have to pee while your face is placed in a trashcan for all you professional chick hovercrafters......everyone's always after my lucky charms...
author: Sasha P.

description: Fish-n-Chips. Mac-n-Cheese. Gui-n-Ness.
author: L W.

description: We had a party here recently. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Everyone enjoyed the food and the event was a great success.
author: Roger J.

description: I keep coming back to this place just because of the location and chill environment. I love the outdoor seating (weather permitting). The food here is decent and thankfully not your average bar food. Their turkey club is exactly that and their shepherds pie is good but kinda small. Great place to come with a couple friends and relax over some drinks.
author: Jason M.

description: I love a good pub, and this is one of the best I've been to state-side.  Read some reviews of this place after just arriving into the city exhausted, hungry and irritable from a long drive. The mood is simple and light-hearted. After wrapping my hands around a much-needed beer, I ordered the Bleu cheese fries (how could you turn those down?!) and they were fantastic, then had a BLT while my friend had the Reuben. Both were really filling and the perfect comfort food after a long day. This place is wonderful, I highly recommend!
author: Katelyn H.

description: Tasty fish and chips (most of the other food is so so), excellent selection of European beers, and one of the best jukeboxes in San Francisco. Get there early to get a seat around happy hour. In fact, just tell your boss that happy hour really starts at 3. Maybe he'll believe you.
author: Aaron L.

description: Cozy little pub.  They have an awesome soup. I know they do cause I wrote it down on my hand, so I could review it.  But I don't remember what kind of soup it was.
author: jack w.

description: Confirming once again that this place has great food, today I tried the burger and was very pleased. The fries were addicting. Dowse them in vinegar and HP, sprinkle a little salt on top, and you're set.
author: Andrew K.

description: Reasonable prices, good beer on tap, a lively happy hour and charming bartenders make the Irish Bank truly Irish in character. We sat out in the alley, and though it was crowded, a little perseverance won us a table. Note that you can't drink outside unless you're seated- we were 'spoken to' about this a couple of times.  An energetic game of musical chairs ensued, but no one was terribly bothered. The fish & chips were amazing (keeping in mind I was at this point 5 pints deep). On a busy night, the outdoor wait staff is pretty overworked, so the impatiently sober may want to go inside for their beer.
author: Amanda B.

description:
this place is heaven for a whiskey drinker like me!!

i was here for only an hour with a friend.. ( went to celebrate finishing a final )

i want to go here again with a group of friends and begin the night...

they got everything..

and all the yippies you could ever look at..
besides that.. a great place..

and sitting outside was real nice..
pretty european feeling and the bartender poured generously!!
author: tanner r.

description: We were looking for a great place for fish and chips.  The fish was great, but the batter was a bit on the soggy side.  Be warned -- do not order a small ceasar salad.  It was $6 for about 4 leaves of lettuce on a bread dish.  Of course, the Guinness on tap was superb.  The service was lukewarm.  Portions were generous.  Nice atmosphere and decent enough.
author: Jo Anne G.

description: This place is kick butt. My girlfriend and I ended up here every night we were in SF. We were staying at the Triton Hotel and this place was directly behind the hotel in the alley. It was a perfect 25 stumbling paces to get back to our room from here. I want to go back just to hang out here again.
author: Dave C.

description: As far as pubs go, this one is pretty damn boring. The crowd is awkward and tacky. Plenty of better venues in this city. Went on a Friday night at 8PM -- it was empty. Not a good sign. Too cold to sit outside!
author: G. J.

description: I've been just for drinks & have had dinner on more than one occasion. The crowd can be loud and boisterous and the bar gets cramped and crowded which can be no fun if your a short person in flats. The Bank does have a warm little space in my heart, I would have to say it gets my top honors as one of the best places to have an Irish Car Bomb. Wonderful to kick back in the alley in the summer during the dusk.
author: Kia B.

description: We stopped in here after dinner in the area and I loved the atmosphere!  They have a great selection of beers on tap, lots of place to sit, and a great atmosphere.  Didn't get any food but it looked good.  The bartenders were also really nice (cool Irish chicks)- they even complimented me on my dress, very sweet!
author: Karen B.

description: What happens when you prefer to stand? Well you just have to leave says the bouncer at this joint.
