Apparantly you cannot stand and drink beer at the same time on their outdoor patio - maybe you pose too much of a safety risk? I don't know - maybe the irish bank has been sued one too many times for slip and fall cases on their premises?  Maybe my high heels looked particularly threatening?  Either way no one tells this woman to sit down.
author: Stacy H.

description: On a warm day, The Irish Bank is a great spot to sit outside in their alleyway and enjoy a couple of cocktails.  They've got a really good selection of bar food, too, so if your Happy Hour session spans a few extra hours than you originally expected, they've got you covered here as far as munchy options go.  I can't wait for the weather to get warm enough to make my next trip here.  (Then again, I guess I could go grab a drink inside where it's guaranteed to be warm.)
author: Katie C.

description: As a Friday Night happy hour place - well, you can do better. Easily. It seems like they have decent food, which is a spot in their favor, but the crowds, and the fighting to order? I can do with out. And the outside area, which you'd expect to be laid back is anything but - the only path to walk around is on the sidewalk, which you can't stand on. Meh, I'm not going to go out of my way to go back here, no sir.
author: neil c.

description: Any place that has outside seating gets an extra star from me.  Other than that is a good bar.  Good beer, nice bouncer, cool bartenders.  Nothing outstanding but I have enjoyed myself here more than once. I will definitely be back when the weather is warmer.
author: Alexis B.

description: Great place.  Went there for lunch and dinner.  Fish and chips were excellent during lunch but the stew I had for dinner was outstanding.  Pint of Guinness was so good I had another.  Definitely will go back any time I'm in SF.
author: Louis B.

description: Disorganized and unprofessional. Couldn't get the waitresses' attention, had to walk up to them and ask for my drinks. My business belongs elsewhere. 1/5
author: Samer N.

description: This place is good for after work happy hours. Sometimes it can be tough to get a table but a little known fact is that they take reservations. The service can be slow, so I would recommend that you purchase drinks at the bar and bring them to your table. Once I went there and my coworker got his burger before i got my beer. They cooked an ENTIRE hamburger and served it before they could pour a beer?! They have good bar food but it's pretty simple --chicken wings, burgers, etc. Good variety of beer...not so much with the wine.
author: lindsey l.

description: I love the Bank when it is so hot out that you don't really want to sit in the sun.  This should actually be like 3.5 stars, because I am sucker for any bar with outdoor seating.  Something about drinking outdoors make me feel so wild and free.  It's a good spot to come to especially if you have a larger group.  Service is usually really attentive and quick.  The food is pretty standard pub fare.
author: Katie M.

description: Great spot... top ten in the city for happy hour and top ten for an outdoor drinking area downtown. For bar food, the grub is actually pretty good! We had dinner there last week and food was served quickly. I had the open faced sandwich and it was a winner. The location is also fantastic as you're just around the corner from Belden where you can grab a fantastic meal / experience I'm here practically every St. Patty's (get there by 4 or else you won't stand a chance in hell at the bar).
author: Annie T.

description:
Some Irish pubs outside of Ireland have names like O'Leary's or O'Conner's as part of their half-hearted attempts to create an Irish ambiance. The Irish Bank gets to the point. This place looks so authentically Irish that you'll start wondering where all the leprechauns are hiding or if the guy next to you is an IRA separatist bomber related to Gerry Adams.

If you sit inside you'll be more likely to believe you're in Ireland thanks to the pub-like wood paneling. The outside seating, though popular, has more of a something-bad-will-happen-in-this-dark-alley theme. Yes, the Irish Bank is in a seedy alley.

I liked the food. Irish food is a bit like British food, but it's actually cooked well. Get the Irish stew. They've also got a bunch of good "Irish" beers. The servers will talk at length about the nuanced differences between the ales, lagers and ciders if you prompt them.

I'm not sure why this pub's a bank though. The payday check cashing joints are typically farther down on Market St. -- not in the financial district.
author: Junius G.

description: Really cute place.  Great for happy hour beers and snacks on the patio. Fish and chips, mac and cheeeee, chicken wings, all grubtastic.
author: Rikki D.

description: About the only Bank I trust these days. Good beer and food, definitely a fun place to meet friends after work. The wait service could be a little quicker, there's always a race among friends to see if it's faster to go inside. If you're not in a hurry, it has a decent alley location and has more space to move around than other FD bars.
author: Chris B.

description: Today was my first visit (not sure what in the hell I've been doing this whole time).  Anyway, loved the food (had the Shepherd's Pie).  My companions had the stew and bangers and all raved.  The long outdoor patio is a lot of fun (particularly when the heat lamps are on).  Service was a bit slow or this would have been a 5.
author: Dayna V.

description: Checked it out last weekend with some friends.  Cool place.  Authentic feeling little pub down an ally.  Pints of Guinness were tasty.  Good pub grub.  I'd go back.
author: Rex S.

description: sitting in the irish bank alley with a pint of czechvar is as good as it gets. though when i went yesterday i was told no more czechvar, which is sad. still, five stars! if it is chilly you can also go inside and drink in a confessional. always a treat.
author: Lala S.

description: I like that it's hidden away in an alley. Like the other bar I like to frequent in union square, this is discreet enough that you will avoid most of the touristy crowd scene. I came during the Bastille day celebrations and it was packed and rowdy to say the least. The other visits were much quieter since they were on a weekday. Good pub food, and beer selection. But the experience is kind of hit or miss. Oh yes almost forgot, the curry fries are a must.
author: X marks the spot ..

description: Fish and Chips were GREAT!  I havent had them this good since the east coast.  Yum!
author: Jaime C.

description:
with seats, cheddar chips, and heffeweisen = 4 stars
without seats, no place to put your coat, and no food = 2 stars.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: Great Irish/English breakfast havent gone there yet for the pub experience but lots of cool pictures on the wall and looks like a great place for a knees up.
author: Robin S.

description: Old school charm + curry fries + outdoor tables + the sun shining + boddingtons = nice
author: Nicolas H.

description: Went to the bank for the first time last night.  A monday night might not be a fair day to judge a bar, but I liked it.  The pews & confessional were a fun touch, the beer selection was good, and it had plenty of seating, plus a fun crowd.  Also a cute waiter.
author: Heidi P.

description: Great place for happy hours and groups. This place can get packed during early afternoons but is fun regardless. There's even a back room that you can reserve for parties. Good beer (even has real cider on tap) and whiskey selection. Food is above average for pubs. Definitely a good spot to hang out and relax with friends.
author: jess c.

description: I feel like I am back in Ireland every time I go there, fish and Chip or Irish Stew are both grand, and of course Guinness!
author: Doug R.

description: this is the happy hour spot! They have a good selection of drinks and the food is good...except don't try the mac&cheese...someone in our group ordered it and it was pretty nasty, others than that everything else I've tried is good. The crowd is usually pretty good and you'll be surprise that this little place tucked in an alley could hold this much energy.
author: meL Z.

description: Great place to stop in and have a few pints. I was happy to see that this place is just not another wannabe Irish bar by the fact that they have on tap all the common Irish brews and food, especially Smithwicks. Their Irish coffees are great too. I especially like the character that this place has. I love how you can sit outside in alleyway of San Francisco and have great beer and conversation with everyone. However, this place can get way to over packed quick.
author: Marco M.

description: In a back alley full of dumpsters, the beers flow like wine and the service and grub were great. Definite cool spot to check out.
author: Uri B.

description: Food is better then average. Try the ruben (corned beef sandwich with kraut) their selection of beer is good and the staff is super fast, efficient and attentive. Went here during office lunch time (12-1) and my water glass was never half empty. Was very impressed.
author: Jose S.

description: Haven't been to Irish Bank in years and we decided to go during Bastille Day.. surprisingly it wasn't too crowded and we didn't have to wait too long for our drinks... I just thought it was funny that the IB was hosting the BD festivities...
author: Nenette Y.

description: Steak fries w/ curry catsup and a pint of Bass! Well, that's my favorite thing to get here. I've had much good times here at Irish Bank. I love that it's tucked away in an alley but that also means that it kind of sucks when it gets packed. The food can be a little slow but the bartenders are super nice and they have some of the tastiest Fish 'n Chips I've eaten to date.
author: Queenie C.

description: Although my friend LOVED this pub, I guess the limited menu just couldn't hold my palette's attention.  On the other hand, the service was prompt, the beer floweth, and if you are in the mood for a casual, laid back pub atmosphere, it's definitely fun.
author: Carmela L.

description: The best fish 'n chips this side of the Mississippi...seriously. And if you're lucky, you can catch a Premiership game on the tele.
author: Michelle V.

description: This a really relaxed pub.  The staff is very friendly and the outdoor area (with seating sometimes) in the alley make for a more intimate spot than a lot of other places.  Try their chicken strips-they are perfect!
author: Kat D.

description:
Great place for professional drinkers, hanging out with friends, having a smoke out in the alley - if you smoke .." sniff..sniff ..whats that smell? ", good pub food,  ... Ive been known to punch the clock for an 8 hour round here, 
 "man is it dark out already???" ... Can get pretty crowded on the usual thursday, friday night lights... hence increased ratio of amateurs, rude people, pretenders, rude smokers, rude suits, tourists, blah..blah..blah..  it's been awhile since i've been back since the retirement from the professional drinking ranks ... I seem to remember ending one of our bar-golf rounds here.. too bad we were mid-round on hole #4..bahahaha..i think..:).. great beer and whiskey selection.. but I can't seem to bring myself to pay 15 -25 dollars at a bar for scotch anymore... good thing, as I perused the whiskey selection..down..down the list..
AHA!!.. sheep-dip!!! 5 bucks...YEAH!!!. ..gotta try the sheep-dip...
.starts out like this..  I'll have a sheep-dip and a pint of guinness puuullleeeasee....#2... I'll have a smittick's  and a sheep-dip pullleeasseee.... #3 ..sheep-dip and guinness sweetie!!... #4.. sheep-dip and schmmmmittick's..baby!!!...#10."hey, we're out of sheepdip"...ah.. can i get a glass of water pullleasee??..... then off to R&G lounge for some deep fried crab...mmm..yum... sh!!t i missed BART?? TAXI!!!!....bahahahaha ..hey..why does my toe hurt?? is that turf toe??
author: Roony P.

description: I met a few friends here to get some beers with the plan to head out afterwards to get some food elsewhere.  However, we never made it out.  Once we saw the food being brought out, we decided to stick around.  Good food, good vibe, and they take their Bloody Mary crazy serious.
author: Bill W.

description:
Great Irish Pub! Nice atmosphere and beer and whiskey selection. 

I taste curry fries at all English and Irish Pubs I visit and I must say theirs did not rank high. But the fish and the chips were pretty dang good.
author: ashley k.

description: i don't like those downtown places because they're so expensive.  I had a good time here though,  with some friends from work.  They have this curry sauce to dip your fries in that is absolutely amazing, and some cute financial district guys that seem to frequent the place.  Not somewhere I'm DYING to go back again, but you never know.  you know?
author: Caleb D.

description: Been going since their opening as the "Bank of Ireland" - food and drink are great, service is attentive and prices are reasonable. Love their alley seating especially in the evenings, their only drawback is how popular they have now become its sometimes hard to get a seat.
author: Maggie M.

description: Irish Bank, I love you. You are the only place in this city where, upon sitting down at your bar after a bad day at work, you asked "what'll it be, love" instead of asking for my ID. Because its nestled in an alley, I always feel like 'one of the gang' walking in. Its my favorite place to meet friends when hanging out in a pub is what I need. Its always warm, the bartender has an irresistible accent, great beer on tap, and, FINE, I like knowing that, should I crave it, I can get a side of cole slaw.
author: Katie H.

description:
i've frequented the bank many a time.  i love that it's somewhat hidden (not so hidden for locals) in an alley on mark lane.  doesn't it sound quaint?  let's just say, it ain't too quaint on st. patty's.  in any case, i'm appalled i haven't yet yelped about one of my favorite watering holes.  they have great brews and lovely pub grub.  i especially enjoy the chips with their curry.  mmmhhhmmmm.  the best thing really.  you can't have chips without the golden goodness.  the mac n' cheese is also divine, as is the shepards pie.  

as for service, i've gotten nothing but good stuff.  i'm a pretty patient person and understand when the place is packed that it will take some time.  the waiters and waitresses are always cordial and bring on the HP sauce when i need it.  no complaints here.
author: Sharlene C.

description: Whether it's the rank old beer ala fraternity house stench or the "just washed" Lysol rank old beer ala fraternity house stench, this place just stinks!  There is one cool place to sit, and that's in the confessional made into a 4 seater booth.  Other than that, it's hot, crowded, noisy and just plain lousy!
author: A W.

description: My friends and I stopped by this weekend and the place was pretty lively with people dressed for halloween.  I would like to come back another time and see what it's like on a regular night.  The beer selection was pretty good and we had a fun a time so I'll definitely stop by again.
author: Laura C.

description: What a downtown bar should be.  It's hidden in an alley and you can sit outside and watch the buildings not move.  If you choose to sit inside, it's an old wooden Irish pub with great beers on tap.  My friend, the Doctor, even likes it and has smashed things there.
author: Steven M.

description:
i ordered a salad that was supposed to have pears, i was really looking forward to them. they used granny smith apples instead, i hate granny smith apples.

decent beer selection. i'll try again later, because i like places in alleys
author: kiki b.

description:
a pint of magners to wash down the fish & chips:  what better way to warm up a cold and windy night?  well...honestly, there are a few other ways but this will do for now.

although i was intrigued by the other yelpers' reviews of the irish bank, it wasn't until i saw that magners was offered on the menu that made me salivate with anticipation.

i was tempted to elbow a girl as she got too close to my food while i was dining at the bar - leaving me no elbow room with which to get my grub on, but i think she may have been drunk.  part of the irish bank's appeal is its popularity so i was content to watch hockey on the monitor above the bar and continued my meal, indifferent to my closest neighbor's inebriety.

the fish & chips were good but nothing to rave about.  they serve it with a small helping of cole slaw, which I can do without but it's good filler in between all the deep-fried delicacies.

the bartenders are kept busy by the happy hour conviviality and they served my magners without ice, just the way i like it.  the ambience is fun and the dcor is what i would expect from a good pub:  low-lit, lots of wood (no pun intended), buzzing with talk, and some random sporting event on the telly.

if you can, grab the confessional booth between the bar and the main dining room.  it's a dining area cozy enough for 4 people and although you can still hear what's going on in the bar, there is much less noise so you don't have to scream at each other to be heard.

i'll come back again!
author: Rosella S.

description: This is definitely one of the places I go most for Happy Hour.  They have really good chicken wings and beer on tap.  Inside the bar, it's rather smelly, but if you go to the bathroom to freshen up, there's this hand dryer that uses G-Force to dry your hands in a quick second!  Hahaha..definitely memorable.  Usually during happy hour, the place is packed with professionals getting their drink on, so by an hour or so, you'll probably want to hit another bar, but it's one of the best places to start the night with.
author: Jin B.

description: Neat set up, though I went a warm day, I'm sure the outside dining wouldn't be all that nice an experience in a cold, sun less alley.  Surprisingly a lot of acutal Irish working the joint, almost too Irish, their accents are thicker than a Guinness slurpee.
author: Sam N.

description: Good for a pint and some grease after work.  Great alley to hang in if you're the smokin' kind.  St. Paddy's Day is always lively.  Just watch out for that bare-knuckle boxing champ if you're pickin' fights.  Periwinkle Blue!
author: Chard M.

description: This seems to be the bar I end up at when I can't decide where I want to go for drinks and dinner. Love sitting outside in the alleyway, but service can be slow sometimes out there. They did give me a shot of Jameson on my birthday, which was awesome. Always hot foreign dudes too.
author: Maren C.

description: An indifferent tap selection, a frantic yuppie crowd, and some of the worst bartenders in the city make this one to miss. If you must, take a seat outside and let the waitstaff weald a clue upside the head of the denizens.  Nice alley, though.
author: Ashton E.

description: if you haven't tried the food here, and have only gotten beer then you are missing out!  The food is delicious.  I recommend the Chicken Strips and Macaroni & Cheese!
author: Hello J.

description: For the 2 times a year one eats fish and chips, make at least one of them here.  Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside.  That's goes for both the fish and the chips.  Oh yeah, don't forget to pair that with a nice Lager.
author: K W.

description: Strong drinks, outdoor seating, greasy fish & chips, lots of dudes and dudettes getting wasted. Party on!
author: J. R.

description: Me and the missus had a quick bite and a couple pints here the other night.  The stew was very good with a lot of beef in it, although a big dollop of mashed potatoes on top of a stew that already contained a fair amount of potatoes in it seemed a bit redundant.  The shepherd's pie was okay, but the center was only lukewarm while the outer part was very hot.  I've had a lot of shepherd's pie in my time and it always puts me off to find stuff like green beans in it.  And was that a lima bean?  Weird.  Anyway, service was good and the Guinness was excellent (good taps, good pour).
author: John A.

description:
cool spot, right next to our hotel.

fish and chips were bangin...the curry sauce with the fries is a must.  

we ate in the alley which was a cool use of space.  a lil chilly on a typical sf night, but we handled it.  inside looked cool too.

i'd go back for sure.
author: Jen S.

description: Definitely an 'after-work, let's-have-a-pint and pub-fare' kind of place 'because its not-so-out-of-the-way'. Clean pub and friendly waitstaff but a sub-par selection of beers on tap. The cheese fries and chicken strips that a couple of friends of mine and I nom'd on while re-hashing the day were something I could have eaten better out of my freezer at home--a bit pricey too if I remember correctly.
author: Krystha B.

description: Fish n Chips and a guiness.  Is there anything else neaded for a meal theses dayz.  Sure you could get the burger, or you could have a stella, but whats the point.  I was on a mission once in life to find fish n chips that were as good as when I lived in england, to this day I have not found them, but the bank is damn close, so I love it.  Great spot to hit up after a long night of tending bar or waiting tables, and now that it is under new ownership all those petty complaints people have will change.  Oh yeah did I mention a good juke box.
author: brian m.

description: I never heard of this place until my co-worker suggested it. It'sin such a cutty place. You wouldn't think (at least I didn't) that you'd be walking in an alleyway to get there. However, when you get inside it's a different story. It's lively, crowded and loud. I am not a beer drinker so all I had was wine. For food, we tried the cheddar cheese fries, sheperd's pie, mac n' cheese, and the sausage and beans platter. It was good. Would I come here again? Probably not. But for a first and only time--I had a good experience because I was with good company....
author: Mel P.

description: Not a wow, but a hmmmm, this place is alright. I like the location on the alley, but there is too much cigarette smoke wafting to the inside. It was bothersome. The food was a hmmmm, it's ok. And I think that is as good as it should be. Pubby atmosphere is always appealing and not a place to dine, just a place to fill up on some heavy food and beer!
author: P C.

description: Like many restaurants and bars in San Francisco, we found this place by wandering down a dark alley. The inside is cozy, and similar to many Irish pubs you may have been to. You instantly will feel at home, and welcomed by the staff and other costumers. The service is friendly, and the food was excellent. The serve Boddingtons on tap, which is all I need to know that I will be back again. P.S. check out the cool bathroom sinks!
author: Rachel R.

description: yummy food and a place you can sit outdoors and drink :)
author: Sunny M.

description: I always get the fish and chips, so I can def. recommend these, along with a pint of guiness or hef to wash it down with.  I find it not to be overly greasy or leave you with that icky "i just ate a ton of fried food," feeling.  Also, It tickles me pink, growing up catholic, that you can eat in a confessional. The waitress was friendly, and while i'd like to rate them down for being slow with the check or not checking up on us, we were tucked away in that "wooden box" and fairly easy to forget.
author: alita c.

description:
My iPhone directed us to the back alley entrance, which was a bit terrifying (scenes from Batman Begins came to mind) so be sure to enter from the front if you don't like wondering what's or who's behind the next dumpster.

The food was absolutely fantastic. The best shepherds pie that I've ever had. The caesar salad was great. The fish in the fish-n-chips was extremely scrumptious -- although the fries were a little disappointing.

Very good beer list w/ irish and belgium beers (among others) on tap. Wish they had more local microbrews though.
author: Karen N.

description: I'm giving this place just 3 stars.  Maybe it was because my bf and I were really tired at the moment when we arrived here and took us awhile to find it since it's kind of hidden in a small alley street.  The atmosphere itself was casual and fun and I can see myself around several friends just talking and having a few drinks here.  They had good beers on tap fortunately (I had a Mirror Pond while my bf had a Boddington) which makes it a "bonus" in my book.  It was a warm night when we had one of those heatwaves the other week and inside was burning hot so we took a seat outside.  It gets pretty crowded and packed so noise levels are high depending who you have surrounding you.  Overall it was a good place but not being a native San Franciscan I can find myself lost trying to find this place again which may put a damper in my night...that said I may just walk past this place and opt for a more "clear" location
author: Kim D.

description: Irish Bank is the place to go if you're craving some fish and chips! Service is amazingly efficient, even during the lunch hour and if you eat in the back away from the bar, it's quiet enough where you can hear your dining companions tell you about their latest exploits.
author: Nathalie L.

description: Every time I come to the city, this is the meeting place for me and my friends.    I've been here both during the day and night time and overall, it's a consistently all around awesome place.  The alley with the trash is pretty rank but you can access the bar from the other side.  Service is great-even when the servers are slammed-which seems to be often.  Gotta give props to anyone who carry like 20 drinks on a tray.   Food is good too-especially the fish and chips.  The only bummer can be how crowded it gets.  When it's full there, it's FULL.  If you are looking for somewhere quiet and cozy-this CAN be the place-but not on a friday night!
author: Nicole P.

description: Reasonably priced strong drinks, good food, great atmosphere, love the awsome alley seating.
author: Tia T.

description: Dug the vibe.  The bartenders were cool and so were the patrons.  Also there were TVs on either end of the bar to catch multiple games. I also LOVE how they have Leffe on tap--that stuff goes down so good and easy.
author: M A N I K.

description: Almost all of my stars go to the beer selection. Really good variety of imports...nummy. Nice outdoor seating if you get there early enough (though I question the effectiveness of the heat lamps). The food is average bar food, but a good accompaniment to the beer consumption. With good company, this place can be pretty stellar. I have never actually been in the bar and have spent all of my time here outside.
author: Alicia J.

description: It gets crowded with yuppies right after work and for good reason. The place is great. Cool outside area, excellent decor, lotsa beer and the food was top notch.  If you like your bars noisy and energetic go here, you'll like it.
author: rob. l.

description: I feel so ridiculously fortunate to live 2 blocks away from the Bank.  It's my default "go-to" spot for both drinks & food alike.  If you like blue cheese, you must, MUST get their blue cheese fries. They are literally smothered in salty, rich, creamy goodness.  It's worth dieting all week to splurge and attack those suckers all by my lonesome.  The Bank also offers super friendly service, and is the closest thing that I've seen to an authentic Irish Pub since my Ireland vacation back in 2000.  So go, drown yourself in good beer and blue cheese, and enjoy your very own Irish mini-vaycay.
author: Whitney H.

description: Nice variety of beers, both local & imported. Good basic food, inside and outside seating area, surprisingly noisier on the outside than on the inside.
author: Lidor A.

description: I would give this place 3 1/2 stars.  Good place for a Guinness or some whiskey.  Fun and loud and packed on St. Patrick's day!  The staff can be chill or rude, kind of depends.  It can be really packed on a Friday after work and it is hit or miss with the service - sometimes slow, sometimes fast, sometimes nice and cracking jokes, sometimes pissed off to be there.  A good, solid bar.
author: Lauren H.

description: This place can be fun, or can really suck...  it is all on the crowd there...  that said, it feels like it is authentically irish, and they have guiness (which is half the draw for most, i think).  Anyways, if you are in the financial district and in need of a frosty brew after work, stop in and see what the crowd is like....
author: Robert R.

description: Astoundingly huge whiskey selection - the best in SF.
author: Don H.

description: LOVE that's in an alley! The food is actually pretty DAMN good for a "pub" but then pubs across the pond actually have good food. And the Guinness well there's my boy!!! Great place, awesome vibe/energy! Never fails me!
author: Rob L.

description: The best Fish and Chips can be found here!  Besides that kick-ass dish, this place is a packed after work location to chill or watch sports.  During St. Patrick's Day, this is the place to be.  My only concern is the how the bathroom is a little suspect.  Oh well, Cheer! (Beer glasses clinging)
author: Jason A.

description: Get the fish and chips, and get some curry sauce to dip 'em in . Cool environment, grab a nice cool Guiness in their breezy alleyway.  Kind of like a little block party.
author: Mark D.

description: Great place for after work drinks on a sunny day.  Gets rather cold outside  if it's not a warm day.  If you're not a smoker, stay away from the outdoor seating, as smoking is allowed out there.  I didn't explore much of the mixed-drink menus, but their Lemon Drop Martinis were lemony-good, especially since I'm not a beer drinker like the rest of my co-workers.
author: San D.

description: Just went to The Irish Bank for the first time last night. Good after work crowd and nice mix of peeps. I didn't get a chance to go inside but the outside patio seating is good fun whether you want to chill, be loud, smoke or kick back with food and cards. If you are looking for a decent beer selection paired with a casual atmosphere the "Bank" is a good choice.....particularly if you would like some Irish fare to go with your pint.
author: Theresa T.

description: Fun spot to have a drink and unwind. If the weather is nice sit outside and eat a burger. I like the chicken fingers and most of their other totally unhealthy food. It is good for what it is; don't expect upscale and you'll have a nice time.
author: Stephanie W.

description: So I went there for my perfect pint.  I had a great server.  Her name was Rebecca and she was sooooooooo hospitable.  She gave recommendations for all the food and knew all about the beer.  And, she HOOKED us up with the ranch for our chicken fingers!
author: Kasey F.

description:
great pub in sf. think of it like a trials in sj ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/trials-pub-san-jose#hrid:narCT2rW7PXqtMFNnsY2_w/query:trials), but with more space and more beer on tap. the bartenders are attentive, and everyone in the pub just added to the chill vibe. there's a back room that is quieter with more tables that serves perfect for eating in peace. i hear the fish and chips is HOT on the menu.  also, there's a large patio with even more long tables with space heaters too. 

i see how the locals like this place and i would definitely come back again.
author: marlene m.

description: It takes a lot to drag me back down the financial on a weekend...ALOT.  On a perfect almost 80 degree Saturday afternoon few weeks ago, the bf had only but to whisper the magic words in my ear: fish & chips. Done. We were on the 45 heading towards the financial faster than he could say it again! We sat outside in the shaded alley, there was a nice gentle breeze, we each had two rounds of booze, ciders for me, beer for him. He had the Reuben, Philly Style (with the slaw in the sando in lieu of sauerkraut) how he likes it and I gorged myself on the Fish & Chips. The chips I wasn't super fond of but the fish, oh the fish. It was perfect! Sigh.
author: Dee I.

description: We were in San Francisco for the weekend and went to the Irish Bank for a pint. Great Guiness pour and great atmosphere. We were there at 10:00 on a Saturday night and not too crowded. The juke box could use a few more selections.
author: Paula K.

description:
I just made a yelp profile, so i could review this place. That's how annoyed I am.

My parents are visiting from Ireland (where I am originally from). We happened across this place on a Saturday, around 6pm and decided to stop in for dinner. Big mistake. 

The service was extremely slow. While the waitress took our order, the barman stood behind her and was hurrying her away for some reason. The beer tasted weird (and I'm not fussy when it comes to beer).

The food was awful - and I mean really bad. I'll generally eat what is put in front of me. But not in that place. I ordered irish stew which turned out to be like a can of progresso soup. My mother ordered the tomato bisque which was disgusting. My father ordered the stew also - it had no meat in it at all (which is weird for stew). I can't remember what my wife ordered, but she just left it on the table.
To add insult to injury, they added on an 18% tip (counting my 10 month old son as a person in order to bring our party number to 6 people).
A truly awful experience and an expensive one too.
author: Cahal M.

description: The Irish Bank is a wonderful place to rest in the afternoon in San Francisco.  It is just south of Chinatown in the middle of the tourist and shopping areas, not too far from the convention center, but it didn't seem to be overrun with tourists like a lot of other restaurants nearby.  The outdoor seating is right in the middle of an alley which I personally found charming.  The food wasn't great, but the basic beers are reliable and priced the same as other restaurants in that part of town.  I ordered a bloody mary on a whim and it was surprisingly fabulous.
author: Evamarie S.

description: I like this place.  Decent food, mostly pub grub as far as I can tell.  Good beer list.  I think the best thing about this place is that it had the nice outdoor seating area.  Not that it was the most amazing patio I've ever been to, but at least it was a bunch of tables outside.  Not nearly enough of that in the city.
author: doug s.

description: I had a great time here the Saturday before St Patrick's Day.  Although there was a huge crowd, the staff was somehow still attentive, got orders correct, and were in great moods - I was definitely pleasantly surprised.  I had fish and chips, which were just so perfect with my Guinness.  I wish the order had one more piece of fish but aside from that, I was very happy with the food.
author: Ennie D.

description: Definitely a poppin' place on St. Patrick's Day.  I came here with some uberirish co-workers and thoroughly enjoyed the beef stew with mashed potatoes I split (one order is very hearty, can easily feed 2 unless you're ravenous).  Service was surprisingly fast considering how crowded it was getting and there was definitely a nice liveliness to the place.  Will have to come back and get another black & tan (now that I know what it is!)
author: Suzanne V.

description: I have never had a bad time at this place!  Love the fact that it's down an alley.  Staff is super friendly, chips are tasty, and the jukebox is kickass!
author: Paul D.

description: The thing I love about this place is I always come here at the right time, when it's not super crowded. They have the best fish and chips and the service is pretty good.
author: Pippi L.

description: Curry fries and Guinness.  Is God Irish?  It's nice to hang outside, but... there is that smell.  To make it disappear, my advice is to eat more curry fries and drink more Guinness.
author: Dave L.

description: Laid back place. They make the best Long Islands. Their mac and cheese made me sick though.
author: Faye S.

description: Ahh...the Bank. How I love thee...with the fantastic "chips" served with curry instead of just plain ketchup. The beers are fantastic and the bartenders are wonderful.  I haven't been (yet) for lunch, but I've been for drinks after work a few times and absolutely love it. The crowd is fun and full of people who work nearby.
author: Jenn G.

description: I don't drink beer and I don't have a regular 9-5 job (in fact I drink gingerale and vodka and don't even have a regular sleep schedule), but if I were the type to actually have a 9-5 in the area, this is where I would come after work to drink beer in the charming little alleyway.  If opposite world was real, you'd find me right here.
author: Marie S.

description: My old friend... I've been going to The Bank forever (or at least it seems like it) and for whatever reasons, and despite its inconsistent service, it's still my favorite place to get fish 'n chips and a pint or two.. with a side of mac 'n cheese.  All the better if we're in The Confessional, but only on a weekend afternoon.
author: umlaut i.

description: The food is ok... their service was pretty slow, and they mixed up charging our cards. They also ID'd me three times, which was annoying, but the atmosphere there is cool.
author: Tarah O.

description: Thank you for easing the pain brought on by my return home from Ireland.  I was so pleased to be in proper pub atmosphere once again.  My mid week crawl started with a co worker's birthday at Rye and ended up here, glad we ventured.  Oh, and it is Smitigs, Not Smithwicks if you want to order such a pint.  Cheers!
author: Alison D.

description: I'm totally coming back when I'm not on a first date so I can sit outside and drink with my posse. Disappointing date aside, reasonable beer prices, friendly clientele, nice bathrooms, and great bartenders = four stars.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Yummy Blue Cheese Fries - and great Irish Bar atmosphere...charming, and I love that its set back in an alley - quaint.
author: Fräulein J.

description: Went here with buddies...had a nice seating arrangement in the alley where they have an array of tables for outdoor seating. The fries are great!
author: Prescott T.

description: This place feels good. It feels even better on a rainy night. It's well lit, maybe too well lit. There's a "confessional" booth that looks and feels a little like one of those tiny houses on the playground. It's fun to sit in. I don't know about the food - the fries portion was gigantic but I didn't try any. Manhattans were tasty. I'm no Manhattan connoisseur. There was also outside seating - neat benches but it was too rainy and late for us to hang out there.
author: Kathleen D.

description: I was wandering around Union Square looking for lunch and stumbled on Irish Bank.  I stumbled even harder on the way out thanks to their awesome beer selection and fantastic Guinness pours.  Irish stew was very tasty.
author: Thomas T.

description: Great Shepherd's Pie and good pub atmosphere.  A very popular Irish city pub and loads of good suds and food.  Nice that they have some outside seating for those sunny days.  A very relaxing place.
author: Scott A.

description: Bangers anyone??? Okay, so I didn't have a Banger when I ambled into this place a car bomb deep and ready for more. I DID, however, have the chicken tenders and they were amazing. Maybe it was the Guiness that made them taste so good...whatever it was, it did the trick. Our server was outstanding, in spite of having a horde of drunk (or nearly drunk) people swathed in green and faking Irish accents flagging her down to order more bear fights (found out about those yesterday...). The drinks were great, the line for the bathroom was never too long, the patrons were fun, and the music was awesome. A great St. Paddy's day was had at this fine establishment! Will definitely go back on a regular day to see if this place is just as great without the holiday masses.
author: Michelle C.

description: This place is really chill.  After a 100 reviews theres not much I can add to them but its a great place to go after work, for a few beers with friends, or whatever.  Sometimes its hard to get the bartenders attention, haven't got that one figured out yet.
author: Joshua G.

description: This is a five star place if you go on a weekend afternoon. The crowds are gone, you can hear your friend talk and there are actually seats.  The reason to bother to walk to the financial district on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon is actually quite simple - the bloody mary.  In my city wide search for great bloody mary's this is probably in the top three.  They have a couple of special ingredients (HP Sauce and a little bit of Guinness).  It sounds a bit odd, but trust me, it is fantastic.  Other than the weekend bloody mary...I give the Bank three stars tops.  Packed bars, where you can't even find a comfortable place to stand, just aren't my thing.
author: Julie P.

description: Good beer and spirits selection.  There fish and chips ain't bad either.  Good Bar staff.
author: Peter W.

description: great atmosphere, classic irish pub decor, outside is really nice, with a covered seating area that diffused the afternoon sun beautifully. Great selection of beer on tap and really good burgers.
author: Milo D.

description:
the irish bank is perfect for lunch or an after dinner beer with food.  this place is two blocks from my work, so i go there at least once a month and have a beer and split cheese fries and a salad, and i must say it's quite a good combination.  the garden burger is pretty good too, and that's all i've had since i'm a vegetarian.  

the waiters are super nice and they have outdoor and indoor seating.  the crowd is business-dude types, as is to be expected from the location, but i just ignore them and go about my business.  it gets loud on certain nights, but is still relaxing.
author: Kate W.

description: I'm rather ambivalent.  Cant say I'd go out of my way to come here.  Mixed drinks were rather poor, but I guess you come to a place like this for beer and shots.  Inside is incredibly stuffy.  Outside is nice if you can get a table, but people are allowed to call ahead and reserve tables.  They wont let you drink outside unless your sitting down, a policy strictly enforced the night we were there, making several people sit on the sidewalk to comply.  I dont know.  Think I'd rather go to Harringtons for the pub feel, or Belden Place for a better outdoor setting.
author: brewgirl b.

description: Man, screw this place.  I don't even want to waste my time writing.
author: Amir B.

description: Don't be a douche and order a Corona or a fruity drink.  You'll get major attitude.  Order a Guiness and you'll be fine.
author: Katie H.

description:
I had a great first time there by myself last week.  It was quite busy but my waitress was on her toes, always ready to refill my pint.  The chicken curry was nice (not really Indian but still good!)

I'm looking forward to going back with friends & sit outside under the stars.
author: Nisaa K.

description: The ambience is very nice, it feels like a genuine pub. The drinks are a little pricey, if you are accustomed to dive bars not faux dive bars neither, but worth it for the handsome bartenders and atmosphere. My friends and I went on a Saturday night, and found plenty of seating in the back. We did not eat there, so I have no opinion on their food.
author: Lindsey H.

description: Best of the Irish Pubs in San Francisco with hyper authentic and delicious pub meals.  The patio is an excellent place to sit on a sunny day, and the interior is lusciously appointed with solid wood fixtures.  I don't dig the crowd, so we hit it on weeknights when it's fairly empty.
author: matthew w.

description: I have seen some really drunk people in this place!  It is in a cool location down a brightly lit alley.  A great drinking hole.  I have never eaten here however.
author: Pele N.

description: How does eating fries in an alley sound? GREAT!!! Ok food with very friendly waitstaff. The drinks are friendly too. =D
author: Eugene G.

description: This is a great place for grabbing a Boddington's after work.   I especially liked hangin out with the rowdy soccer club and the Irish bartenders.  Great people, great beer, what more could you ask for?
author: John D.

description: Went here after work for happy hour w/ a large party.  It was nice that we had a table outside, but I would have to say that it is pretty crowded and our waitress was not very pleasant to my co-worker. I'm sure she was overworked and underpaid, but aren't we all?!
author: Lorraine Y.

description: It's no wonder the Bank was voted the best Irish Bar by San Francisco's 2008 Reader's Poll. This place is wonderful for groups with both outdoor seating and a spacious interior. It may always be crowded but that's a sign that they're doing their jobs right. We started a 150 person bar crawl here and Ronan and Stephanie were both enthusiastic, helpful and easy to work with. (They cut straight to the point which is much appreciated!)  Lots of people come here after work but it's also great on Friday or Saturday nights. The food is awesome too so stop in for a pint and some fish and chips.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Cool ally and private booth.

EXTREMELY OVERPRICED!

No hot bartenders. Just a bitchy old Irish lady who seems bitter about her station in life.

I would only suggest going on St. Patty's day.
author: Adrian B.

description: If you're looking for a place to spend St. Patrick's Day look no further. This is your one stop Irish Pub that will satisfy all of your Patty's day needs. You have the inside of the bar where you find your libations, and the outside where you find music, people, and more drinks. It doesn't get much better than this.
author: Casey W.

description:
since "the bank'" is downtown and has a few tables tucked into a dark little alley, it's the perfect spot for getting a beer in the middle of your work day without being found-out. there is also a super-secret place to sneak a drink inside the pub (this is for you to discover).

as for a nibble to go with your pint, the fries are damn good, but even better when ordered "cheesy" and with a side of curry.
author: Kelly B.

description:
I work next door. It's cool. The waitresses that serve food outside are very ditsy. Despite the fact that we visit this spot at least twice a week, they never remember us (maybe i'm just forgettable). 

The bartenders serve horrible drinks and rotate through a lot (i.e. they don't work there very long). Last week we ordered a few Irish car bombs - we were starting out a big night - the guy gave us a fifth of a pint of Guiness and half a shot of Jameson and asked for $12! We refused and the old-school bartender came over and had to school this new guy... it was a joke, but is not an uncommon occurrence here.. the bartenders are not trained well and are not very friendly. i think that's why they don't last too long.

nice selection of scotch - however, they measure the scotch when they pour it - it is measured as 3/4 of a shot glass - horrible way to do it.. 

the only reason we go here all the time is location location location.

for veggies -- the veggie burger is not a gardenburger or a boca burger -- it is something else i don't know too well (i hope it's not real meat!).. good textured v-burger. verry nice. however, it is always served cold !! 

park in sutter stockton garage if driving in to this place.
author: David F.

description:
I pretty much hate the Irish Bank, but that's only because I enjoy good food and service.  I've been there twice now.  Here are the highlights of my two experiences.

First visit:

-  After sitting at the table for quite a while without being asked if we wanted food or another beer, the waitress finally came over and said, "Oh, I'm sorry.  I forgot about you."
-  After moving inside due to rain, I tried to get another beer from the waiter who refused to serve me until I closed my tab with the bartender.

Second visit:

-  I ordered the "Chicken Wings" expecting Buffalo Wings, but got breaded fried wings with no sauce on them.  You might say this is my fault for expecting Buffalo Wings.  However, the wings came with ranch dressing (which you would not expect with regular chicken wings), and when I asked if they had blue cheese, the waitress said no, and it never occurred to her that I might be expecting Buffalo wings (or she just didn't care).  Not only did they come with ranch, but they also came with a BBQ sauce that tasted like the BBQ sauce at McDonald's when you order McNuggets.
-  There were about 8-10 wings on the plate, which cost $8 (almost a buck/wing, which is absurb when they don't even come with a half decent sauce.
-  Seeing as how I couldn't eat the wings, due to them being disgusting, the waitress asked me if I wanted to box them up (they were UNTOUCHED).  When I said no, she just carried them off and threw them away, never asking me if there was something wrong.  In fact, I watched the cook ask her why the wings were untouched, and she shrugged her shoulders and walked away.

My ratings for Irish Bank-
Food: Gross
Service: Horrendous
Prices: Decent except for the wings
Beer Selection: Half decent
Atmosphere: Deceivingly nice
author: Alexander J.

description: Without a doubt, the closest thing you will find to an authentic Irish pub in San Francisco.  The menu will be familiar to anyone acquainted with pub grub, but in this case, the ingredients (with the possible - and warranted - exception of the bangers) are spot-on.  On many occasions I have braved the cold and rain on a winter workday to sample the Bank's Beef Stew over lunch.
author: Peter V.

description: This is one of the better pubs to celebrate St. Patty's Day, but the other 364 days of the year are dull. Small bar, and slow service for being small and not so busy. I only stop by for a quick beer if it is on the way to some place more exciting. Beer selection is good which always makes me smile.
author: Erik W.

description:
I went on a quiet Monday night, and had some fish and chips. I wasn't expecting health food, but it was extra greasy (and not in a good way). The batter didn't stick to the fish like it should, and the chips were overly greasy. It looks like they let everything sit in the deep fryer too long. It's not a complicated dish, so there's no reason to do it so poorly.

The bar stools had soft tops that were cut up badly. Upholstery repair, anyone?

I really would like to give this place a better review, but I'll wait for another visit. Who doesn't like nice Irish pubs? Just make small changes that say "Welcome! Come on in!" instead of "This place is sliding towards dumpville, and we don't care." Serve the same type of food, just take some care to do it right. Fix up small things like the bar stool tops to show that the management cares about the impression customers get.
author: Marc S.

description:
This place is exactly what you'd imagine it to be, and having lived in England for the past six months, I can definitely say that it exudes a genuine pub atmosphere. (And yes, I know it's Irish, not English, but you get the point.) The pub vibe extends to the large patio outside, which looks like it'd be a great place to enjoy an extended lunch out in the sun (whenever SF actually gets sun, that is...).

I went here with a group of friends who wanted to do something fun, but casual, on a Friday night, and who didn't want to spend a ton of money. The Irish Bank fulfilled all those criteria. Guinness is, obviously, on tap, and I really enjoyed my Irish stew. The other people I was with ordered fish and chips, which they pointed out was not as greasy as it is at most places. We also all enjoyed the music, and the bagpiper who played for a bit while we were there.

All in all, definitely worth checking out!
author: Sherri H.

description: The Ploughmans is a disgrace. Thin deli triangle slices of tasteless "cheddar", some generic wheat kind of bread instead of brown bread and if that was a Bransten pickle I'll be a monkey's uncle. Come on you guys - an Irish pub that doesn't even have proper brown bread? How hard can it be in this town to get a supply of good brown bread, a nice juicy pickle (doesn't even have to be a Bransten, just not the limp deli spear that was on my plate) and a wedge of decent cheddar? For shame.
author: Michelle B.

description: Love this Irish pub!!!! Its so close to my work, I can walk there after a long day of HELL. Get a tall glass of chilly beer and a nice meal of Fish and chips in pefection and everything is beautiful again!!!! Great comfort food for the weary and stressed !!!!!
author: Sera O.

description:
Was initially skeptical about this place because it's down an alley. But, after getting a drink and chilling out, this place wasn't that bad. It was quite wonderful. The bartenders were great and attentive, even though there was drama standing behind me. Everyone i was with had a nice time. The place, though, was packed. Not much space inside to walk around or find a spot, but then, it was friday afternoon. A lot of people who had been there before had said they were shocked to see it sooo packed. It's a nice little place that you wouldn't think of going. 

Minus a star because a bartender(who was helping me) had to break up a fight in the bar and then the staff was a little peeved after that. Really should have been the bouncers job. As well as the space and getting a place to congregate with other people.
author: Mark M.

description: New to the City and were excited to find a Pub.  Typical Pub Style.  We ordered two Harp Beers and the Fish and Chips.  Beer was ok but the Fish came to the table unable to be cut with a knife.  We told the bartender and they brought us only one piece to replace the three that were on the first plate.  When we asked for the other pieces we were brought one more piece of rubbery fish.  Time to leave - asked for bill and the bartender didn't discount or remove the fish - don't recommend!!!
author: Heidi Fossel M.

description: Fun, fun, fun! Loved the backra and beers. Like Ben and his friends. Casual place. Will return time and time again.
author: Peter E.

description: Nice place for drinks; great pub atmosphere. I haven't eaten there yet. They usually pull in an interesting crowd, it's a nice place, friendly staff, and it's right behind the Hotel Triton one of my "go to" hotels in SF.
author: Josh B.

description: A little small, but they have Smithwicks and Boddington's on tap, and the fish and chips were great.
author: Sara F.

description: Any time the family comes into town and wants to do the old tourist shopping thing; I thank my luck stars for the Irish Bank.  Close enough to Union Square and Market Street that I can run and have a pint before my aunt has even finished trying on her outfits.  Not that I ever did that.
author: Joe W.

description: Holy bacon cheddar fries! Beer is a bit overpriced, but you pay for the mood. Summer nights in the alley at this place make you all warm and fuzzy inside-- or it could be the Smithwick's. Oh, and ask for the hot sauce with your fries.
author: Brandy E.

description: Good location, good Irish/British food, authentic drinks, lots of Scotch to sample.
author: Bill J.

description: I love the Irish Bank!  If it's just to have a beer outside with some friends on a warm night or for dinner I always enjoy going there.  My favorite dish on the menu is the Reuben Sandwich, I swear it is the best I've ever had!  Service is usually pretty good.  The only thing on the menu that I wouldn't recommend so far is the Chicken Curry dish they had on there.  In a city with so many amazing places to get a good curry dish, don't put a mediocre one on your menu.  Oh and when you go, make sure to get some of their delicious fries with the curry sauce (I know I just knocked their curry but this is seriously good and a different sauce from the one they put on their Chicken Curry Dish.)
author: Rachel S.

description: Went today for Lunch at 1pm.  Service was just fine when Waitress finally came over to us -  We had to go to bar for drink & order our own drinks - which happens, I know. I can relate during the lunch hours. However,   Our Fish n Chips was not  good.  The chips were fine, but the Fish was off, as was the tartar sauce.  And the portion for the price, is not a good value.  BUT, having said that, its "A-OK"....
author: J M.

description:
why do irish and drunk go so well together???
every time i have been here it has been a blast.  and the good thing is that everyone else  is just as wasted as you are, so you do not have to worry too much about embarissing your self.
author: charlene l.

description: For my first St. Patrick's Day in the city of San Francisco, I found The Irish Bank to be a great place to spend it.  Admittedly, I didn't spend much time in the interior of the pub but rather the alleyway adjacent to it with about 300 other people.  The people were cool and the night was a success.  I will definitely patronize the place again under more normal circumstances.
author: Eric W.

description: Countless people have told me that the Irish Bank has the best fishand chips in town. Oh how wrong they are. I imagine those that find this fare tasty have had a pint or five in their gullet. Now mind you they do serve up a nice pint. I found the food portions to be small and considering I was one of threee people in the restaurant, waiting 20 minutes for my food was ridiculous. The batter while light tasted like flour and was not the delicate batter associated with a good fish fry. I will go to the Pig and Whistle where they actually have the best fish and chips in town.
author: D Scott D.

description: I like the interior of this place: dark and chunky. I like that you walk into an alley to get to it.
author: Erin S.

description:
i've been here twice. the first time, i was a trainwrecked from the night before, and the cocktails whipped me right back into shape.
on my second trip, i was in the hotel right next to it and went for dinner. my steak was delicious, albeit a bit small... however, when coupled with a side of fernet, just right.
author: jorge b.

description: Visiting the SF Auto show and wondering around Union Square;   The chalk board sign got me into this irish bar.  I had IPA beer, and bank burger.   It was a winner!   I come here again.
author: Kenny A.

description: Alley way Irish pub, serving terrible food. It's a pub and it was our mistake going here for dinner. I ordered the baby back ribs and I am glad that I was sitting in an alley without much light cos that lighting prevented me from getting a better look at the piece of meat in front of me. I'm sure better lighting would have ruined my dining experience even further. I could see shades of gray and ribs that looked and tasted like they had been cooked a couple of days ago. The ribs had absolutely no sauce or flavor on them and I could swallow a few bites after dousing them in BBQ sauce at the table. The waiter said that the ribs were slow cooked.. and after my meal I'm left  wondering how long they had been slow cooking for. Absolutely avoid food here and stick to what a pub is good for - beer.
author: Getafix O.

description: a really great alley bar! gets packed after work and good happy hours. you can sit outside or inside. they even have a real "confessional" booth if you're feeling guilty about something... kidding aside, the bar's great and they even have really good food if you want to eat.
author: Michelle I.

description: best bar in the financial district. a little pricey (compared to my inner richmond digs). but great atmosphere, lot's of good people watching, yummy smelling food (haven't tried it), and a good selection of beer on tap. i highly recommend this place, but then again, who doesn't?
author: Rachael S.

description: As an british ex-pat, I had the best fish and chips here since leaving the UK 8 years ago.  I've always been on the search for some good British style fish & chips.  I found it here!  My friend had the Shepheards Pie which which was also awesome.
author: Mervyn M.

description:
threw another big happy hour there last eve.  i can see why this place has been so popular for so long.  it's reliable.  gives you exactly what you want and expect.  it's a local pub with some nice outdoor seating, some good fried foods for munching.  good beers on tap.  clean (mostly) bathrooms.  the staff is courteous and efficient.  the staff was even able to (mostly) remember what all 50 or so people drank from one round to the next.  they kept careful track of what everyone ordered - as opposed to what a lot of bars do which is just throw on your tab 100+ drinks that you can't even recognize.  they have a real piece of paper that denotes that someone actually ordered that drink.  score one for the low-tech solution.  when everything is done via computer, you don't really have a paper-trail to prove someone really took that order.  i suppose it's possible that they manufacture the paper receipts but that's highly unlikely and much less likely than someone mistakenly assigning drinks to your tab by clicking on the wrong button.  

the chicken wings and the chicken tenders were pretty good but that might be just because i was hungry.  the beers were good.  i had two IPA's. the back room was cleared out for us and the efficient staff made sure our happy hour was announced and written on the little chalk board thing that they put out on pine street.  when you throw a happy hour for 50+ people, there's a huge long list of things that could go wrong: 1. bad or slow or no food 2. bad/slow drinks  3. too crowded 4. bathroom issues 5. coordination issues. 6. space issues.  ..... so for the Irish Bank to pull it all off smoothly with no issues was very good.  i don't necessarily know if the IB has some incredible features that would push the review to 5 stars but it gets a strong 4 star review for it's efficiency, pleasantness, and fine execution.  this place is going well and it's not slipping.
author: dan h.

description: good place to meet up with friends for some pints after work, but that's it. the fish and chips isn't very good here. last time i had it here was last satruday afternoon. the fish wasn't hot and it was awfully chewy too. i'm still in search of a good fish and chips establishment here in sf. it ain't anything like london - that's for sure.
author: James J.

description: A chill place to hang out w/ friends after work or school.  Wide range of booze, especially Scottish and Irish whiskeys.  Location and atmosphere make this place worth going to.
author: Travis E.

description: I liked this place a lot specially the environment. You can sit outside and I liked the concept a lot. I had their Fish and Chips and I liked it a lot. I would highly recommend it.
author: Amit K.

description: My roomate Brendon works there and I LOVE Guiness.
author: Firstname L.

description: every time i've been here, they're playing U2 or bob marley on their sound system...go figure.
author: Pickle R.

description: First time there... Wednesday .... stopped in for lunch and a few.. was not too sure about the lunch but the drinks were definitely part of the plan .... have to say we were super happily suprised with our meals ... so yummy and great portions ... we had the fish and chips along with bangers baked beans and mas.... Oh My Gosh... wish I had a bigger tummy ..... Mary is the best! When I grow up I want to be her!  All kidding aside.. great selection of beers ... good food ... great skill behind the bar ... I am already looking forward to our return!
author: Dora G.

description: Great hidden getaway in downtown.  Typical pub atmosphere but a nice downtown crowd.  I like it better inside than out for some reason but at least there are options!
author: Misti L.

description:
The Irish Bank sucks.  Sucks bad. Go somewhere else.  Here's why:

We've gone to the Irish Bank periodically after work from Friday drinks for years.  It's always been OK, but nothing spectacular.

We went there last night- Friday after work with a group of about 6 of us.  They have tables out front in the street, but they were all taken.  We got drinks, and were standing up outside.  One of the staff- a manager?- came over and told us we had to sit down.  No niceties, she just came over and started in.  I pointed out the complete lack of open seats and asked her to bring some to us if she demanded we sit down.  She then told me I was rude and said that if they lost their street use permit it would all be my fault.  She walked away and we managed to scrounge two chairs.  Then a male member of the staff came over and told a couple of use we couldn't sit on the curb of the sidewalk, it was a "fire lane".  So they stood back up.  Then the lady came back and told us we couldn't stand up there, but could move down to the end of the alley and around the corner.  We unhappily complied, and took the two chairs with us.  So guess what?  If you go around the corner, the other alley there is full of dumpsters.  This was lovely on the hot September afternoon.  Nothing like the smell of rotting trash to make after work drinks an enjoyable experience.  Putrid rot, anyone?  Oh, and that's also where the gaggle of smokers was, so trash and smoke- lovely.  So we were there for a few minutes and then one of the same guys from before comes over and says , "If you're not going to use those two chairs I'm taking them"  I told him we'd be using them.  He then told me that they had plenty of customers and didn't need us.  I told him I thought he was being rude and overly demanding for no reason and that he wouldn't need to worry about having us as customers again.  Surely there must be other places that are at least as good at service overpriced drinks, trash, no seats, and a rude and hostile staff.  There are so, so, so many good establishments in San Francisco, do yourself and them a favor and patronize a different establishment, and leave the Irish Bank to wither away.
author: Ross S.

description: since we didn't make it on time to the guinness tasting a few blocks away, we thought we'd keep to the theme and check out the irish bank.  i LOVE irish pubs for some reason.  i think the combo of good beers on tap and pub grub just make for an excellent after work hangout.
author: Helen T.

description: Fantastic bar! Hands down the best walking distance from my house. Great staff, consistent service, good beer and mixed drinks, tasty food, plenty of seating. When friends and family come to San Francisco this is where I take them. Highly recommended (God I hope it doesn't become overcrowded someday soon)
author: T S.

description: great whiskey selection. crowd is entry level meets middle management for a drink.
author: Matt P.

description: Great atmosphere.  Good food.  Friendly service.  A nice haven between the madness of Chinatown and Union Square.  You can actually have a conversation in here.  I've only gone during lunch, so that's my experience.
author: Betty M.

description: an awesome pub that has a great atmosphere, incredible guiness and the best fish-n-chips in the city hands down!  they also play a decent amount of u2 during happy hour :-)
author: Swarup B.

description: great place, great food.  I've been there a few times and I love it.  Went there for st. patty's day and left f'd up.  service was a little slow even when not many people were there.  no biggie, had a great time.
author: John B.

description: i really like this bar, especially for after work drinks.  lotsa good beer.  a little expensive (but it is the financial district).  nice relaxed vibe.  indoor and outdoor seating.  need nothing more.
author: jessie h.

description: the beef stew is great here, and it's nice just getting a drink after the work-a-day, but the best part about this place is the fucking insanely loud and powerful hand dryer in the bathroom.  when you use it, every piece of loose paper towel in the room starts flying around like you're in a category 5 hurricane, and you can actually hear it down the block.  be sure to try out this repurposed leaf blower, even if you don't need to pee.
author: Michael M.

description: this is my favorite place to tie one on with co-workers (after work, of course).  the bartenders are friendly, there's food if you so desire and (i've always found) enough places to sit. the heaters are a bit few and far between in the alley, so if it's a chilly night might wanna head inside.
author: Joanna M.

description: good pub to meet friends in the city at. always packed, always real genuine (and generally drunk) people. i like it.
author: ms.kiki g.

description: I've been here twice and the crowd has been nice so far.  It feels like the people that come here just come to hang out and have a good time.  I came with a group of people both times and one time we pulled out cards and started playing drinking games.  There was a couple sitting close to us, kind of towards the older side, and they were full on making out and touching...too much PDA!!  But other than that..the night was fine.  The servers and bartenders here are welcoming and super nice too.  I don't remember if there was music....but eh, don't really need it I guess then.
author: Trisha H.

description:
great Location, 
unfortunetely being irish myself I was prepared for the bad customer service. 
We waited 10 minutes for a waitress who told us she was just finishing her shift, then she sent out a guy 10 minutes later who looked a little annoyed, then the rest of the meal consisited of me reminding them "sorry, could I get that water" and 3 different servers dropping off different things. Weird atmosphere, maybe the staff had a big fight right before I got there.
I WOULD go back.  (1 more chance.)

IRELAND!!
author: Tasty T.

description: Great food in the restaurant. Nice atmoshpere. Perfect for lunch.
author: Joe P.

description: i came here in the early evening and had the BEST bloody mary ever. im a huge bloody mary fan and this was so good. they have a choice for spicy and regular and writing about it is making me want one. i think the guy who makes the good ones his name is Mike..maybe. They have good bar food and its a cute little irish bar. its really vintage and warm like here. maybe its the faux fireplace.
author: andree t.

description: love it! great location, great staff, great food, great ambient... super, super, super!
author: Ilovelife Z.

description: Great Downtown Pub!!  Great food and drinks!  This place, established in 1996, is under new ownership and back to its true form.  Although outside seating is great it can be crowded, and nothing compared to either St. Patricks Day or Bastille Day.  Little inside info., the French Holiday- Bastille Day (June 5th) is actually the bigger party, shhhhh!
author: Dylan T.

description: it used to be so fun.  we would all go there after work and drink and go out at least 20-30 of us.  then everyone was fired or quit and it became a lot harder to make money.  i haven't been there for a while but when it was good it was good.
author: Anthony Y.

description: i love the irish bank. it's the go-to alley for beer and greasy pub food. the curry sauce with the fries is amazing. the fish and chips rock. this place is awesome for watching the game. the big screen in the back packs in a good crowd.
author: joseph j.
